Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Afternoon Tea at the Fullerton Bay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lozzzzie
Reviews.Content: Came her for afternoon tea and had the choice of sitting in the lounge area or the bar - I sat in the bar overlooking the water and Marina Bay Sands. The lounge area also looked very inviting and comfortable. The afternoon tea was beautiful - a good variety of delicious, well presented savouries and cakes with unlimited tea and coffee. The service was flawless. The afternoon tea was replenishable but I really couldn't fit anything else in! So don't have lunch before you do this! I also went to the Fullerton Hotel for afternoon tea a few days later - it was quite nice but not up to the standard of the Fullerton Bay. You can have a glass of champagne for an extra S$10, otherwise it's S$42 plus taxes. It's worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Fullerton Bay vs St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: affluent_traveler
Reviews.Content: During our holiday in Singapore we stayed at two properties,Fullerton Bay & St. Regis. Fullerton Bay hotel is beautiful,contemporary, and you are in the heart of business district. The view from our room and balcony is stunning,the room luxurious,amenities excellent, & service & staff provided more then expected. We couldn't help but compare the two hotels and our heart kept coming back to the stay at Fullerton. The whole atmosphere and ambience of the hotel was something we felt fitted us. Maybe its the small scale,the openness,the water,the views? Both properties are ultra-luxurious- you have to decide which area you rather be in. Mr Giovanni Viterale is doing a great job with his staff and we hope it stays at this level when we return. Pool area- outstanding but seating will only accommodate under 30 people,never was full though Breakfast Buffet $50 per person was outstanding and couldn't wait to wake up to go eat! Fitness area small but had the equipment I needed

Reviews.Title: “Good but expected more for that price”
Reviews.Author: cedayr
Reviews.Content: This was a romantic get away and the hotel worked just fine. The bay view from the room, pool and rooftop bar is just amazing and the staff is very friendly. However, considering the price level of this hotel (twice the price of the quite nice Intercontinental), I was expecting more. Little details that did not cut it for me at this level are: - plastic glasses at the rooftop bar (unacceptable considering the price level and the drinks served -champagne, premium wines and cocktails-) - pool stairs deliberately blocked by customers in their lounge chairs (to avoid passage near them). The staff saw this and did not address it (a pregnant woman had to "jump" from the side of the pool to get out) - TV not working during the second day; never solved despite gentle request in the morning - main bar is quite gloomy and looks like a hallway - no fresh juice proposed at breakfast; not-fresh-from-the-day breakfast baguette

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andymill71
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a fantastic location. We stayed in a bay view room, the room was beautifully appointed and the service was excellent. The reception staff were excellent and the breakfast was outstanding Thoroughly recommend this hotel, you wont be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Maldivesgirl
Reviews.Content: Checked into the Fullerton bay for an overnight stopover en route to Thailand. Loved everything about the hotel. The contemporary classic decor, the wonderful staff and the thickest carpet ever, made a welcoming, comfortable environment. We stayed in a Bay view room which had a wonderful view over the Marina Bay hotel where we watched the laser show at 8pm and again at 9.30pm. We had drinks at the roof top bar that evening which was lovely, fabulous setting with gorgeous fairy lights and wonderful cocktails. Breakfast the next morning was delicious and we loved the high ceilinged breakfast room - again more staff than guests and very attentive without being annoying. The hotel granted us a late checkout so we were able to stay in our room until our 2pm taxi to the airport. Couldn't have been nicer and will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: lizp2
Reviews.Content: Our family of four spent two nights in a Heritage Room - a comfortable room with a large bathroom, including a freestanding shower. The service at the hotel was fantastic - we arrived at breakfast on our first morning just as the staff were packing up all the food, and asked for an omelette to be made. Nothing was too much trouble and it was delivered to our table with a smile. The hotel concierge was very helpful in suggesting a few restaurants within walking distance of the hotel and also booked a good dinner table for us at Long Beach on Dempsey Hill. The interiors of the hotel are beautiful and the location in the Financial District is great. The Marina Bay area offers shopping and restaurants all within easy walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Four Dressed Up as a Five”
Reviews.Author: BASLJM
Reviews.Content: There is lots to like about the Fullerton Bay Hotel. The hotel amenities and rooms are beautifully designed (providing that you like modern architecture), the location is central to the Financial District (I was travelling on business) yet also next to the Marina District with its many shops and restaurants, and the service was friendly and helpful (though hardly a unique attribute for high-end Asian hotels.) The rooms and bathrooms are of adequate size though certainly not generous. They are well appointed and, with floor to ceiling windows, offer fantastic views of the Marina. A nice fruit plate was waiting in the room (though it was not replenished during my six night stay which is often the case in other high end hotels) and there was lots of bottled water that was replenished daily. The Bose docking station was a nice touch. There was a good desk and chair in the room, which was important since this was a business trip. The hotel's location is excellent if you are here solely on business or a combined business/pleasure trip. While there is lots to do around the Marina area, it is relatively new and still has a bit of a sterile feeling. (I stayed at the St. Regis on Orchard Road before my meetings started and there is much more vibrancy up there.) Be sure to watch the nightly laser and water show over by the Marina Bay Sands Hotel; you can see the show from the roof deck of the FBH but it is a 10X better experience watching it from the other side. There are 10 or so restaurants within a couple of hundred meters of the FBH: the ones I went to were adequate but nothing stood out. My rate include internet and breakfast. Both were first rate. The Internet was easy to access, connectivity was excellent and download speeds were pretty good. The breakfast buffet was also excellent, with lots of fresh fruit, both Asian and North American hot dishes, pastries, cereal, and a fresh omelette bar. All this sound pretty good so why not five stars? Despite all these pluses, there were several, albeit relative minor, issues that tarnished the hotel's shine. 1. Room service food was very disappointing. I had lunch twice, selecting an Asian option both times, and I was delivered a meal on par with what one would find in a North American food court. Both times the meal came quickly (about 15 minutes) so I suspect that they keep prepared menu items in warming trays. Anyway, avoid room service unless you are really desperate. 2. The food at the Lantern Restaurant on the roof top deck was also mediocre. (I hear the Clifford is quite good but after three pretty crummy meals at FBH, I did not want to pay up for a meal from a team that has a pretty lousy track record.) 3. I called for a laundry pick up. They forgot. Fortunately, I was here for another couple of nights so it was not a problem waiting another day for it to be done. (Laundry is very expensive, though not out of line with other high-end hotels charge.) 4. There was a problem with the light beside the bed: a wiring malfunction that caused one light to flicker even though it was turned off. I asked to have it checked and was assured on my return that it had been taken care of. I turned the lights off that night and the light started to flicker again. Normally I would have just unscrewed the bulb but access was restricted by screws. I called down at 10:00 pm (I was still jet lagged and just wanted to go to sleep) and had to wait 30 minutes for them to deal with it. This is a reasonable waiting period but it should have been fixed the first time I asked. 5. The pool is beautiful. Unfortunately, the are only 8 loungers (and no chairs) around the pool. There are also 3 shaded "pods" near by. Whenever I went up to the pool, there was no place to leave my stuff because the 11 places available were all taken. The roof deck area is first and foremost a bar/restaurant and the pool is sadly nothing more than a water feature. This was just a bad design decision. 6. The gym is small and poorly equipped. 7. The rooms are already starting to show some wear and tear. Most noticeable are the hairline cracks in the bathroom sink and the poorly fitted closet doors. Management is going to need to stay on top of these areas or the hotel will run down quickly. Bottom line: Don't get me wrong, this is a great place to stay. However, management needs to up its game if they want to maintain their reputation as one of the best hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: moontatravellers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fullerton Bay for three nights in March this year as a stopover on the way home from Malaysia. The hotel is faultless, from the doorman to check in and personal escort to our room everything was friendly and professional. As it was our wedding anniversay whilst we were there upon arrival at our room there was a chilled bottle of Moet, fresh fruit, cakes and chocolates with a personal card from the Management wishing us a happy anniversary. What a lovely surprise and it didn't stop there. The breakfast in the gorgeous Clifford restaurant was fantastic, great array of food covering many nationalities and if something wasn't there you wanted they would make it for you. My tip is ask for Eggs Benedict with the smoked salmon - to die for! Nora is a great hostess there and even organised a surprise desert for us when we dined at the Clifford on the night of our anniversary. The hotel is spotless and the room facilities and decor were second to none. We had a Premier Bay View Room with a large deck and loungers looking straight over the water to the Marina Bay Sands. Perfect spot to view the nightly laser and music show whilst sipping some fine Champagne. The bed was very comfortable and the robes were so luxurious that I bought one to take home. We had a late night flight home and although we had to check out by 12 noon the hotel kept our bags safely locked away for us until we were ready to leave. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, they were really well trained but very friendly as well. I would recomend staying there if you can afford it - hotels this good do not come cheap and for a special occasion it was worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “A nice experience!”
Reviews.Author: MrsMK
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights over the CNY in January 2012. It's a lovely hotel as so many guests have already written here and certainly one of my Singapore favourites. I loved the beautiful materials in my sea view room and the bathroom and the common areas are very stylish as well. I enjoyed the room service meals and I found the breakfast quite nice and both had items suitable for vegetarians as well. Maybe the menus could be more varied in thet respect. The pool is best for grown up lap swimmers, which I appreciated. However, the pool area is my main complaint about this hotel. Funnily enough it's a bar area in the evening and there are too few shaded loungers and any proper loungers at that. The loungers are at ground level so if you have any knee/ back etc problem you'll find it terrilbly difficult and not at all flattering to get up from your lounger. Most of these loungers are "in the pool" and without any shade. Who wants to fry herself in the sun these days? All in all the area seems more designed to twenty somethings, altough the clientele seemed more middle aged to me. The pods are nice, but there are only a few of them. An other smaller issue I want to mention is the air con controller in the room that is very difficult to manouver without any instructions, it went straight back to really warm. The former applies to the balcony lock as well. If these issues could be made better this would be a wonderful hotel and in my opinion one of the best in SIN .

Reviews.Title: “All Class”
Reviews.Author: easy1153
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a 3 nightstop over in Singapore in March 2012 after a break in Malaysia. We decided that we deserved a treat so after some research in Tripadvisor we chose the Fullerton Bay. From the moment we arrived at the entrance to be met by checkin staff and personally escorted to our bay view room we knew we had made the right choice. The Fullerton Bay is a small hotel (100 or so rooms) in a suberb location close to excellent Singapore transport options. We had a bay view room (311) that gave an excellent front row seat for the light show from the hotel across the bay. The hotel design is nothing short of stunning with a 'wow' at every turn. Having said that, it is still intimate and you can feel comfortably at home...a neat trick. From the rooftop pool and Latern bar to Landing Point and Clifford restaurant this place is all class. The service is understated but always what 5 star should be but so often isn't. Treat yourself....you won't be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Fullerton Bay Hotel simply elegant”
Reviews.Author: Audley17
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel near the Marina, without question, this should be your choice! It's a small, boutique like hotel with 5 star service and amenities. The roof top pool has a beautiful view of the Marina. I must say, the food I ordered at the pool wasn't great, however the breakfast and the dinner I had at the hotel was exceptional. The martini's at the lobby bar were perfect and the concierge service was really helpful. I felt that the staff really went out of their way to make my stay comfortable and enjoyable. I requested early check in and they accommodated me at 7am, with a room at no additional charge! It really does have a small hotel feel with, again, 5 star service. Oh, one thing, if you have a taxi dropping you from the airport, make sure you say Fullerton BAY Hotel, they have another hotel called Fullerton Hotel nearby, which I was first dropped off.

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely room but extremely variable service”
Reviews.Author: grinchee
Reviews.Content: I arrived here after my stay at MO, Singapore which was a perfect stay so its fair to say that the bar had been set high but on arrival at FB I had to have 3 room changes. The first room they had put me in a twin bedded room. Yes it was for single occupancy except on the last night but they had not distinguished between single and double occupancy when selling me the room so this was rather cheeky and after I had got used to the sprawlingly big bed at MO I didn't think I would be super comfy here. I had arrived at 7pm and the staff on duty at the time handled things a little clumsily in my view. My experience of the difference in service between here and my last hotel was immediate. Perhaps its to be expected of a younger hotel like the FB but its place at the top of many reviews had also made me expect more efficiency and finesse from the staffs handling of problems. Other than the twin bedded aspect this room on the 5th floor was perfect and my subsequent room transfers left me wishing I had stuck to the original notwithstanding a more restricted bed space arrangement. I was moved to a lower floor even though I had specifically requested a high floor in my booking. I suppose the issue here was that there are only 5 floors to the hotel! But I would have thought that a high floor request usually indicates a preference for quietness away from the noise on the street etc. This was especially relevant since the second room I was given was facing Customs House (a collective of bars and restaurants) which is open until 2am most nights- not great noise factor for a light sleeper. Even worse was the strong musty smell pervading the 3rd and 4th floors not only in the corridors but also in the rooms. I note that other reviewers have mentioned this. Its a real problem which the hotel so far refuse to even acknowledge which doesn't help matters. So I was moved to a third room which had been freshly sprayed with air freshner and by now it was 8.30pm and it was a case of settling for this room or cancelling my plans for later that evening. The room itself was the most spacious and beautifully appointed room and I was told that all rooms are the same other than the floor they are on and the outlook which determines their category. The entire hotel is quite stunning if you appreciate the Starck/ New Design style. The only room I stayed in which has this wow factor is at the Viceroy Miami but generally its not easy to find a standard category of room in any hotel across the world of this calibre. I think the FB has just won the best rooms category in Conde Nast also and it is well deserved. It has the highest ceilings, huge mirrors and floor to ceiling windows giving the room such a great boost of natural light. The room at MO, Singapore was too deep to catch all the light and the ceilings much lower so it wasn't a great room to spend alot of time in. The FB rooms even have a smoking/ sun balcony as standard. Its a great feeling to stay at a hotel that is so generous in its allotment of space to its guests in this way. Bathroom was also spacious with walk in shower and huge bath. The bathroom amenities were the new range of MB (or specially designed for Asia) but had just too much perfume in to use generously. Housekeeping was minimalist and not the best. Towels were of a cheap (hard) quality for this category of hotel. The lighting in the bathroom and bedroom was perfect. The entertainment system was modern and easy to use. The gym is modern but tiny and poorly equipped but (perhaps for that reason) no one seems to use it. There was no bottled water in the gym which was surprising- just old jugs of water with orange bits- looked unappetising. The pool is on the top floor with the Lantern Bar set around it. The latter is always busy so if you like to swim with privacy in mind you won't get it here. Having said that it does create a very nice hang out area in the day and night and bar staff are especially friendly and welcoming. Like many new design hotels the FB has an 'uber-cool' reputation amongst the locals and yes it does have the wow factor that MO lacked. This makes it special especially for the younger crowd. But I have not yet come across a hotel which balances the service versus cool factors together perfectly. It seems one always comes at the expense of the other! But if you have any suggestions otherwise please contact me as I always like to keep informed. Breakfast was a big disappointment- the fruits were not the best quality and the range was small. They should serve freshly squeezed juices as standard where the fruit is available in such abundance instead of having to make a special request for it at breakfast! Ofcourse I would probably have not said this had I not had breakfast at MO for 6 mornings previously but I was not paying that much less here so it could be fair to expect the same. The breakfast room itself was a great space, light and airy although not many nooks and crannies for those seeking a more secluded breakfast experience. Taxis were normally easy to get since the FB is off the highway and they can be flagged down quickly. Infact the location of the FB is very nice as you can easily walk to many bars, restaurants, and right by the waters edge. If you walk over the bridge connected to outside of the hotel you reach Raffles Place with its boutiques and nice cafes or catch the MRT. Its in the Financial District and you can sense this as you go out in the daytime. I would have given FBH 5 stars but for the variable service, the underwhelming breakfast and the odour in the hotel- since it ticks many boxes for an otherwise great stay. The rooms are the best choice if you are working indoors in the day so I would definitely consider staying here again if they could do something about the musty smell.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore rising star”
Reviews.Author: Bimbo37
Reviews.Content: Small hotel on Singapore measures, true five star. Very nice contrapunct to old Fullerton Hotel, mix of new and old... Amazing location, excellent rooms with all the perks and above all ... The Lantern pool bar in the evening is probably the best place to taste Singapore skyline. This place really surprised me! Try evening walk around the bay, its safe and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Charles C
Reviews.Content: We were staying for 4 nights in Bay View room during our honeymoon on Feb 2012. We arrived at night at this hotel. We were greeted with friendly staff and had our luggage taken care of promptly. The staff kindly guided us to the reception table where we checked in for our room. To my surprise, Ifa the reception staff, guided us to the lift and all the way to our room, as well as explaining all the room's amenities. Usually in other hotel, we had to find the room ourselves, but this time it was different and I think it's a nice touch and personalised service that the same receptionist who checked you in also show you the room. My wife and I really like the bed and pillows at this hotel. It's really comfortable and we really had a good sleep every night. Bathroom is pretty standard although we feel they should make more room on the bench in bathroom to put our toiletries instead putting an oversized sink. We love the fact that our room has free wireless internet access and all the power point in the room already had international adapter built in it. So you do not need international adapter to connect to your room power point. Sadly, during one night of our stay, we had an inconsiderate neighbour from room above us who decided to turn up house music at his room around 23:35 and had a loud chatter on their balcony. We called the duty manager to complain about the disturbance and within 10 - 15 mins the noise subsided significantly. Our recommendation for this hotel is to prohibit any loud music or chatter on private balcony after 22:30, because it really disturbs other hotel guests. There was one particular incident that made us really impressed with Fullerton Bay personalised service. While we were waiting for our pick up to the airport at hotel lobby, the handle on my wife new luggage suddenly just broke apart. She just purchased that luggage 2 days ago at Marina Bay Sand. We frantically try to find a replacement luggage and we were running out of time before our pick up arrive. Fortunately the concierge team noticed our dire situation and in particular, Deborah, offered us, herself, to take the broken luggage to Marina Bay Sand and get it exchanged with new luggage. Of course we had to pay for her taxi return trip, but her prompt assistance really help us a lot and in no time she came back with new luggage so we didn't miss our flight back to Australia. Overall, we feel that this hotel is catered more for business traveller or couples or people travelling with their friends. Not so much for family that travelling with kids. Furthermore, if you want to experience a different level of service during your stay at Singapore, I really recommend to stay at Fullerton Bay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: revilo77Dubai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fullerton on business and it was a great experience. The rooms are nicely appointed with generous bathrooms. Everything was in its place and the bed was very comfortable. Service at the hotel was defintely 5-star standard, quick and professional. I used the spa on 2 days and the treatments met my expectations. TIPP: if you book your next spa appointment immediately when you leave the hotel they will give you a discount. I had lunch at the Chinese restaurant and it was probably the best Dim-Sum I have ever had. Very nice business hotel in Singapore which I would recommend. I would also stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeNRI
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Fullerton Bay Hotel on the 18th of Feb 2012 We were pleasantly surprised . I can say this ..... If it fits your budget , just stay here I live in Singapore since 6 yrs now and hence have not stayed at many Hotels in Singapore since 2006 . Except one stay at the RWSentosa. My worst memory of the other Singapore Hotels that i have used are the rude porters......... BUT NOT at Fullertonbay Hotel ....... the porter and the concierge were very efficient and very very polite . Top points to them . I had a voucher for a free nights' stay at the Hotel from AMEX . The reception checked me into a Cityfacing room based on the package . I had a preference for a Bay facing room , the front desk staff were very very friendly and professional , they were happy to move me into the room of my choice at a nominal fee . I accepted their offer ..... and believe me it was money VERY WELL SPENT . They gave me a room on the 6th floor , and with a view to the Bay . The room was MOST Modern and exquisite . It came with a small balcony which overlooks the Bay ... It is a great view and to add to it .... it also allowed us to watch the MBS light show in the night. The Toilet and toiletteries were excellent Porter and Concierge : Very good Reception : A young Japanese man checked us in and he was very very efficient and professional . Not overly friendly , but just right .. made you feel comfortable and at the same time did his job effectively . Poolside Staff : As we walked out of the lift on the Pool Level , we were greeted by a friendly hostess , who i believe was part of the restaurant / bar they operate there , but she made an effort to introduce the area and locatio of towels etc to us Pool : Looks compact when you first see it , but once you jump into it ..... its perfect Open air Jacuzzis by the pool : Very well built , providing sufficient privacy due to the hedges planted around it , open on one side giving you a view of the sea . The only constraint ..... they have built a walking path on the open side of the jacuzzi , so while we were in the pool one elderly gentleman just strolled by and was taking pictures of the sea view with his back to us. Not realising that we were in a jacuzzi in the back ..... but making my wife a bit concious , since it has a glass front . He was surprised when he saw us and smiled and moved on Housekeeping : At check in , we requested an extra bed to be brought to us at 830pm . When it was 830pm i was thinking whether they would remember my request or i will need to remind them . But just after 830pm , there was a knock on the door. The man who came to layout the extra bed was efficient and friendly Lantern : Nice place to chill out in the late evening with a glass of wine and light snack , on day beds or regular tables or high stools at the bar. Nice view and atmosphere. A very much recommended Hotel , either for a family holiday .... or even business since its very well located a stones throw from the business district of Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Best to date for business”
Reviews.Author: Shahzeen-Shah
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week on business in summer last year and I have to say, of all the hotels I have stayed in for business in the last 7 years, The Fullerton by far exceeds them all in every way. Room facilities, dry cleaning ready overnight, large swimming pool, wireless available by the pool and a separate office area for those who need access to printers etc. The location is fantastic, with great views across Singapore skyline. The breakfast covers every cuisine around the world! We walked along the pier in the evening to have the classic Chilli Crab at a fantastic local restaurant called Jumbo (a restaurant recommended by the front desk). Most restaurants are within walking distance and you also have access to the sister hotel, The Fullerton, which has a fabulous roof top bar/ lounge. My trip and stay was so good I plan to return next year with my husband. Definitely worth a stay here if you are here for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “get the bayview room with jacuzzi”
Reviews.Author: thedogcoffee
Reviews.Content: I live in Singapore and stayed in FBH on a staycation. Prior to making a booking, I emailed FBH to enquire if I could look at the various rooms in the property. They were very accommodating and took me around the hotel and highlighted the special and differentiating features of each room. The room I was really interested in checking out (and eventually stayed in) was the Bayview room with Jacuzzi. This room was magnificent. It had large bay floor to ceiling windows and boasted an infinityJacuzzi on the patio. This jacuzzi is perched over the water and enjoys stunning, stunning view of the Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore skyline. A big perk of the patio jacuzzi was an unparalled view of firework display that was put on. There really is nothing like enjoying the fireworks from your jacuzzi as you nurse your sundown yamazaki.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely 5 Star!”
Reviews.Author: LaurenOel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the privilege of spending a night at this luxury hotel to celebrate our 18th Wedding Anniversary. I booked the "Romance" package and we were not disappointed. We were upgraded to a Bayview Premier room with incredible views over Marina Bay and were treated to the beautiful light show from Marina Bay Sands on Saturday evening while we enjoyed a romantic dinner on our balcony. I believe they have thought of every possible amenity to put in the rooms. From the amazing Nespresso machine, IPod docking station to a TV in the bathroom with a pillow in the bath to rest your head! Yes, you will pay 5 star prices to stay in this hotel, but you will definitely get 5 star service and 5 star amenities. If I ever have the opportunity, I will definitely return to this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not just a hotel, this is an experience”
Reviews.Author: Gail R
Reviews.Content: The Fullerton Bay was recommended to us and I can say we were not disappointed. The hotel is ideally located, plenty of nearby restaurants and shopping. Very easy to get around. The staff were excellent, the service first class and the rooms whilst not overly large are beautifully appointed and have a great balcony. The hotel decor is elegant and tasteful. This hotel is not cheap but then why would it be?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at Fullerton Bay”
Reviews.Author: John_Perth_WA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fullerton bay in Jan 2012 for three nights for a stop over returning to Australia from our Euorpean Chistmas holiday. The hotel is expensive but really fantastic - it has a lovely setting directly on the water looking over towards the Marina Bay Sands. The rooms are modern but elegant - beds great and bathroom is fantastic. We had a nice balcony overlooking the water, Nespresso machine and complementary internet. The service we had was really good - and we got along well with all of the staff. The roof bar and pool is very cool - but can be very busy at the weekends. The dining room is amazing with very tall ceilings with beautiful decoration - breakfast is also excellent. We highly recommend staying here - although we are staying at the Intercontinental for our next trip (F1) - the Fullerton bay is in a different league...very boutique and chic. It is also miles above the Marina Bay Sands which we had a look at during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “In a league of its own!”
Reviews.Author: CarolinesCapers
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my parents as my mom had a medical appointment. The property itself was charming and simply marvelous, with a wonderful view to match. The service was really top notch and impeccable! We had to give breakfast a miss as we were running late (though breakfast had been delivered to the room). I asked them not to clear it as we would be back by mid morning and we can then have breakfast. The front staff told me that they will clear it and keep it warm and we can call them to have it delivered again when we got back. The medical check took longer than expected and we got back after 2pm. When I called the front desk they informed me that they had thrown the food away as it was no longer fresh and would make us fresh ones instead. They even called to check if my mother was feeling better. The staff there made it a very pleasant and memorable stay. I would definitely return if I ever was in town.

Reviews.Title: “Well located Boutique Hotel in the Marina Bay Area”
Reviews.Author: Rob1010
Reviews.Content: The Fullerton Bay Hotel is a swish designer property, which is an offshoot of the Fullerton Hotel. Its location on the bay opposite the Marina Bay Sands and next to the CBD makes it an ideal watering hole for itinerants visiting Singapore, be they tourists or business types. The hotel is small enough to be classed as boutique: its shiplike steel and glass design sits on top of an old pier from the days before land reclamation overlooking the newly created bay. The rooms are architect/ designer uber cool, complete with glassed in bathrooms, sliding glass doors, waterfall showers, electronically operated curtains and unfathomable electronic light switches. They feature every amenity: Nespresso machines, iPod docks, international power sockets, and free WiFi. Our room was on the ground floor and had a deck which faced the Marina Bay Sands, with its Louis Vuitton Island shop and its absurd aerial boat. While very attractively designed and very functional, the rooms are just a bit too small – you tend to collide with many of the designer square edges in the night and the clothes storage space is woefully inadequate for two on an extended trip like ours – a small wardrobe and two drawers! The public areas are limited: the formal dining room is attractively finished in a more traditional style in a nod to the old Fullerton Hotel – we had an excellent buffet breakfast there, although the hotel has no idea at all how to make cappuccinos! There is a bar/coffee shop area in the Lobby, which is rather lacking in atmosphere, and a very nice open air rooftop bar, where the hostess seemed reluctant to seat us as we didn’t have a reservation! On our first day, the air conditioning had been set to arctic levels everywhere (even colder than the usual in Singapore). On the second day, the temperature was far more agreeable. Our overall views? This is a good property which is probably better suited to the two night trip business stopover than the holiday trip we were on. At SGD 680++ the value for money is not quite there – you do better service and room wise at the Raffles, the Ritz Carlton Club floor or at the Shang, for the same or less money. One final word: the staff need to smarten up a bit: while pleasant and accommodating, they reveal no sense of passion for what they do and they tend not to go the extra mile for their guests. Having said that, this is a new hotel and the service levels will improve over time.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: sue m
Reviews.Content: This the 3rd time we have stayed in this hotel and it is most definitely the finest in Singapore in our opinion, the service, quality of food, ambience, quality of rooms and facilities is second to none. You feel special when you stay here, unlike our friends who felt just one of a number in their huge impersonal hotel.. We enjoyed our wonderful buffet breakfast each morning overlooking the river, loved walking to boat quay at night, the hotel is central for just about everything, and the concierge - James Dean was just so kind, helpful and knowledgeable. Indeed, all the staff were amazing. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. Our room had all the facilities and more that one requires for a stay whether for just 1 night or in our case 6. The rooftop pool is a haven for relaxing after the heat of the day sightseeing and the Post Bar a lively place for a drink in the evening. Nothing is too much trouble for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Wizzie44
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights in this stunningly situated hotel on the bay in a bay facing room, well worth the extra to be able to enjoy the stunning day and night views. Breakfast was a feast of delights and healthy options. Great location for exploring the sights of this beautiful city, hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: snozzerWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 6 nights at the Fullerton Bay Hotel in a Bay View room. The hotel is beautiful and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Our room was very spacious and very well presented, pleasant decor, was exceptionally clean, and was cleaned twice a day by the room attendant. Our trip was part business, part holiday, and we felt that the hotel was suited to us both. It is very well located for sightseeing and close to the metro. Breakfast was good, plenty of choices for all tastes. To sum it up, this was the best hotel that we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Fullerton Bay Hotel is great”
Reviews.Author: ACulinaryJourney
Reviews.Content: We spent a night each in the Fullerton Bay Hotel during our wedding anniversary and my birthday. The bay view rooms were elegantly and tastefully designed. And we had a great view of the Marina Bay Sands and its light show. The dipping pool that came with the room was well secluded from other guests on the same floor. And it gave us the feeling where the pool ended the Singapore river began. The wait staff in the hotel lounge was professional, cheerful and helpful. And the food in its western restaurant was excellent. They even made a special dessert for me when the staff found out that it was my birthday that day. The only down side both times centred on the service during check-in. They were very slow and had some of our check-in details muddled up. ======================= http://AppetiteTeasers.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “Singapore's Best”
Reviews.Author: never2tired2travel
Reviews.Content: Fabulous new hotel on the Marina Bay... probably much better looking at the Marina Sands than staying there. Beautifully and thoughtfully appointed rooms, attentive service and excellent food at the Clifford for fine dining and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ruoninis
Reviews.Content: Very good location and service. Nice pool and bar on tje top of the roof with excellent views!

Reviews.Title: “continues to amaze”
Reviews.Author: jonjon97
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth time staying at the Fullerton Bay (2nd review), as I travel to Singapore quite bit. I have to say, it's a real treat to stay at this hotel. Every detail is perfect here, from the Molton Brown products to the sheets and duvet. Service here is impeccable. And I never tire of the view of the Marina Bay, especially at night, from my balcony. It really is my favorite hotel in all of Asia. Lantern Bar on the roof is a very nice spot to get a drink. Estelle, the guest relationship manager there, is very friendly and helpful with insider Singapore tips!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding at Fullerton Bay Hotel, Clifford Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: karineli
Reviews.Content: My wedding was held on 11.11.11 at Clifford Restaurant. We stayed one night at the Fullerton Bay Hotel in a premier bay view room. - It has become my favourite hotel in Singapore, love the spectacular views from the room, the hotel design and high ceilings, the lovely 'fullerton bay hotel' perfume when you enter the hotel, the polite staff, the nespresso machine in the room. The Fullerton Bay Hotel had some little delights waiting for us: a room with number 111 which was a lovely touch to our wedding date 11.11.11. In the beautiful room, there was champagne, macarons and fruits when we checked in and flower petals and beautiful towel arrangement on our bed after the wedding. - the service was top notch at clifford restaurant. although there were some hiccups in the beginning as it was the first time they were organising such a wedding, the staff went the extra miles to make our wedding really special. They accomodated many of our requests and even exceeded our expectations with perks and lovely surprises like champagne, bouquet. On the wedding day, everything was almost perfect (except for the sound system/mic which was a bit soft on that day). Special thank you to Fullerton Bay Hotel General Manager Mr Giovanni Viterale, F&B director Mr Sugu, Assistant Manager Mr Prakash, Guest Relation Executive Mylene, Nora and Thong. - the venue was breathtaking. all the guests loved the high ceilings, the alfresco area overlooking the bay, the solemnisation setting, the lovely flowers settings(which were done by the appointed florist of Fullerton Bay Hotel. - we were delighted by the wine choice by the restaurant sommelier Mr Siva. Many guests asked for the name of the wine after the wedding! - the wedding cake was customised as per our request. Not only was it lovely, it was delicious!! A big thank you to executive Pastry Chef Chris for taking time to meet me, to allow me to try the different types of cakes and for such beautiful creation for my wedding. - we requested for a semi buffet style and it was kindly accomodated. The buffet set up was beautiful and the main courses wagyu steak and cod fish were nicely done. We were apprehensive that with the 80 guests, the standard of the buffet and main courses would be compromised. However many guests commented it was the best steak or the best meal they ever had for a wedding. we would definitely recommend Clifford Restaurant for intimate events and fullerton bay hotel for a lovely stay with amazing views.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Lippi-2906
Reviews.Content: By Singapore standards a relatively small hotel, only six floors, which makes it more intimate than some of the larger hotels. Great location on Fullerton Bay, opposite the Marina Bay Sands casino...far enough away to not be disturbed by it!!!! We had a huge bay room, 0616, with a spectacular view. Room was very quite and peaceful. Level of service was fantastic, nothing too much trouble, great buffet breakfast with far too much to choose from. Hotel it in business end of town, not shopping district (Orchard Road)... so location depends on what you are after. Taxis are cheap and only 10 mins to Orchard Road, so much less hectic surrounds than that area. Great roof top pool area and bar, thought the gym was too small, but not a big problem. Not cheap, but none of the top hotels in Singapore are. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore at its best”
Reviews.Author: Mowbray_B
Reviews.Content: Prior to check-in at the Fullerton Bay, I was staying at the Marina Bay, which was just horrible. In comparaison, it is passing from hell to even. I was staying in a Bay view deluxe rooms. They have 4 categories, standard, deluxe side view, deluxe front view, and suites which are at the corner. Each rooms have similar decoration and great amenities. Rooms are very quiet, great bed confort, and nice set-up. The people working there are very nice and efficient. Had a long talk with the GM, who clearly knows his business. A must try, is the roof top bar and pool. When I was staying there, the DJ was French and very good. A lot of ambiente, with very good drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PKTVI
Reviews.Content: great hotel, grest seafood buffet on sunday ! love it @ stayed there 3 years ago, will be back soon !

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've found in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: claphambt
Reviews.Content: Stunning high quality property set right in the water; the pictures don't do justice to the breathtaking quality of the materials and furnishings here. We had a poor first impression as the room we had booked wasn't available (we were offered twin beds instead of a king - they offered to move us the next day but we didn't want the disruption. They were very apologetic however. The bar on the rooftop is one of the best in the world we have been to with exactly the right atmosphere - select enough to feel special, relaxed enough to be fun. And the bar food is superb. The room was relatively compact but made up for it with stunning views of the bay and beautiful furnishings and up to date technology including breathtaking mood lighting. We never dined in the main restaurant - the bar was such a lovely place to be - but we did have a delightful afternoon tea in the lobby - well worth the cost. The location is superb - right on the bay and a short stroll to the subway system; taxis are cheap and plentiful. We loved this hotel and it goes to show that ultra-modern can be just as or more luxurious as 'retro' luxury. Everything was just beautiful, and the service is impeccable. I was feeling unwell one evening (hangover!) and the concierge actually sent someone in a taxi to a pharmacy on my behalf; they only charged us for the taxi fare and returned with the item within half an hour.

Reviews.Title: “A most beautiful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sue B
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive at the Fullerton Bay Hotel you know you've made the right choice. We stayed in a Premier Bay room which had a large balcony and an amazing view across to the Marina Bay Sands area. The Molten Brown products and TV over the bathtub make relaxing very easy. Everything is sparkling clean - housekeeping come twice a day and do a great job. If you do decide to stay here, you must try the afternoon tea (far better than at Raffles). The breakfast is also wonderful - especially in such beautiful surroundings as the Clifford. The cappuccinos are particularly good. Catching a taxi to Orchard Rd shops only costs about $6, so you are very central. The shops across at the Marina Bay are huge - I'm sure we didn't manage to cover all of them. Finally, the staff at the Fullerton Bay are some of the best we have ever encountered. Nothing is too much trouble. They obviously recruit and train very well. A fantastic experience! We would definitely stay here again if in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you would expect”
Reviews.Author: Considered
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fullerton Bay en route home from Europe and enjoyed every minute. Flight landed at 7 in the morning so my room was no available (I had not requested early check in I should add), however the staff were fantastic in organising use of showers and change rooms. On return my luggage had already been transferred and the room set out. The room was very large and the amenities were exceptional. Staff were always available to assist and were friendly and welcoming at all times, especially the breakfast shift manager who welcomed each guest like a long lost friend. The hotel is situated in one of the newest sections of Singapore right on Marina Bay and within a moderate walk of the Casino. The roof top pool and bar has spectacular views across the marina, and for the exercise minded like me, the gym is small-medium sized but well appointed. All in all a very pleasant stay and a hotel I would have no hesitation in recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Heaven in a City.”
Reviews.Author: sohJ
Reviews.Content: One of the most memorable hotel stay I have ever experienced. Everything was to perfection without trying too hard. Wonderful architecture, interiors and service. If you have some extra bucks to spare, stay there. It will be worthy.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: albertocortes
Reviews.Content: i srayd in the FULLERTON BAY on 1 of dec the rooms where just great i wish all the hotel rooms in hotels where like this one the breakfast was very good the roof terries restaurant and bar is great the service is excellent location very central i will absolutely go back

Reviews.Title: “A stunning hotel amidst many a stunning hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dayle P
Reviews.Content: The Fullerton Bay Hotel is the sister hotel of the grand Fullerton Hotel. Beware making a mistake with the names when booking. I did and thought I was getting a great deal for The Fullerton. It turned out to be for The Fullerton Bay Hotel. MY distress turned to delight when I saw the room. I have travelled extensively and had the good fortune to stay in many 5 star luxury hotels, but this was a new cutting edge hotel. It is modern without being clinical. It has all the gadgets, but is serene and calming. Asian inspired but not clique. Absolutely stunning. The bar upstairs called The Lantern Bar is breathtaking and a hang out of the cool and beautiful young things, of which Singapore has in plenty. The breakfast buffet was small but well formed. The breakfast dining room was grand and spacious. Location is just on the edge of the CBD but wonderfully central at the same time. A easy block from Boat quay and a leisurely stroll to many shopping malls. Love it and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else. I lived in Singapore for 7 years , so I'm very familiar with whats around. The Fullerton Bay is everything I could want on a visit back ( home)

Reviews.Title: “Bravo Fullerton Bay Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: markphillips_9
Reviews.Content: The Fullerton Bay Hotel is one of the most if not the most memorable hotel experiences I have ever encompassed. Everything about the hotel was perfection! The service was first rate everybody was very friendly, the facilities were excellent I spent quite an amount of time at the pool. My room was just gorgeous (i had a bay view room) the view from our balcony was unbelievable! The dining experience was phenomenal - the food was impeccable! I had other friends staying in Raffles during this time and i went to visit them and can I just say there was a much noticable difference in better service at the Fullerton Bay right from the very get go getting out of the taxi on arrival! Both my wife and I were actually sad to say goodbye on check out! I look forward to stopping off at Singapore in the future and I will 100% be booking to stay at the Fullerton Bay. I have no hesistation recommending the Fullerton Bay Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: t50
Reviews.Content: I often saty at the Fuulerton across the road when I visit Singapore but this time I though I would try the Fullerton Bay. I missed the breakfast at the Fullerton but in all other respects I found the Fullerton Bay superior. This is largely because the rooms are more unifrom and outward looking and therefore all have a view of one thing or another. They are also very well fitted out. The staff was very welcoming and accomodating even to the extent of scanning and emailing documents at 11.00pm.

Reviews.Title: “Location great but not a great place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: sting800
Reviews.Content: Design is great, though not all that convenient - the concierge and driveway are a good 100m walk away from the reception and building with the rooms. Lots of noise leakage into the room from outside (see tip) as well as from the connecting room. Service at the front desk was aloof and not very warm or welcoming. Breakfast buffet was decent and service there was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base for exploring Singapore”
Reviews.Author: katherinemmpd
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my honeymoon in Asia where we spent two nights at THe Fullerton Bay after our outward flight to Singapore. The Hotel is very new and a complete contrast in appearance to its sister hotel The Fullerton which was formerly the old colonial post office. The hotel is located on the quayside with fab views across the harbour the the vast Marina Bay Sands hotel. On arrival we were checked in and upgraded to a suite, which was a great surprise and a very welcome one as I had planned this part of the trip as a surpise for my husband. We spent both evenings after dark at the Lantern Bar on the roof which has a lovely swimming pool and some comfy chairs. The bar is very popular with guests and locals alike and was full both evenings. Great atmosphere and service although quite pricey but that was not so much of an issue for us as we had expected it to be. Hotel Suite was excellent and well laid out with a balcony and seperate lounge. Two huge flat screen tvs which we have to say we used as was quite jet lagged. Staff service was also great and nothing was too much trouble. the only downside to the hotel was the breakfast buffett which was fairly disappointing but not the end of the world. Would certainly go back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and great view, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Andrea44sg
Reviews.Content: There ae not many rooms, about 100 of them. Quiet and nice place to stay, excellent service. If you got the bayview rooms, the scenery is excellent, looking at the Maison and Marina Bay Sand. The breakfast has got good selections. Love the roof top bar, Lantern, you can even rest and relax there in the afternoon. I have tried the afternoon tea a few times, very English, very nice, love the lobster cone. The Clifford serve good food too. The hotel is really clean and smells really great. Staff are really friendly. They supply great toiletries (Molton Brown), more than basic and almost everything you might need. I really enjoy my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: NW28
Reviews.Content: I don't really have anything to add from other reviews as we were so happy with our choice to stay here. It well and truly met our expectations, and one aspect that we were really impressed with was how each and every member of staff we dealt with seemed to go out of their way to be of assistance, and always with a big smile. The room was luxurious and well fitted out, the breakfast was decadent, the location was ideal (MRT station, 7-11 and plenty of restaurants close by within walking distance!) - what more could you want? Easy walk to Marina Bay Sands, or take a water taxi (near the Merlion) to Clarke Quay and walk off your dinner on the way home. Would not hesitate to recommend and would stay here again in a second!

Reviews.Title: “a fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RazNe
Reviews.Content: After having stayed at the Fullerton many times, I tried the Fullerton Bay (same group). In general, I was very pleased. The staff and level of service was simply top class. I had a couple of issues with the room, which was immediately fixed. The bar at the top and the cafe on ground floor are also well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: shireenikhsan
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but excellent praises for this hotel.They have made my annivasary stay such a personalised & memorable one.From the second that I entered my room at the Anderson Suite i was already blown away.With flower petals everywhere and the breathtaking view I felt as though I was in another world. I love the fact that they did their homework in finding out that me & the husband were muslims & they took the liberty to prepare prayer mats for us on our bed & painstakingly took out all the alcoholic drinks from the mini bar. Our annivasary dinner in our room was also prepared specially for us from their halal kitchen. And when we brought our kids to the room the very next night they treated them with great hospitality with sweet treats and knick knacks. Everywhere you go in the hotel you'll be treated with a smile. I have vowed to return to this hotel for a staycation soon and I shall not doubt that I would be treated the same way or maybe even better! Well done Fullerton Bay!

Reviews.Title: “Outstandingly remarkable!”
Reviews.Author: mccheah
Reviews.Content: Fullerton Bay definitely ranks as my top choice in SIngapore.Truly first class! My time in Singapore has always been superb whenever I stay at Fullerton Bay. This is probably my third time with Fullerton Bay within the last year. I had the bay view room (410) and the view was just perfect! Every room comes with a nespresso machine and I had a lovely time indulging in a hot bath and a cup of coffee in the mornings. As my conference was at the Fullerton hotel, a complimentary ride was arranged for me. Walking is also possible, along the main street which passes by One Fullerton and under a passage way which leads right to Fullerton. Fullerton Bay also has an amazing roof top bar Lantern which spots the most amazing sight of the Marina Bay, perfect for if you wish to have some quiet time to enjoy the view. If you're lucky you might even see a display of fireworks! If you're feeling sociable, you could take a walk over to One Fullerton where many pubs and eateries are located. My friends and I had a good time at Overeasy, a pub which served really delicious snack platters. We had a variety comprising their signature fries, bacon wrapped prawn with blue cheese dressing and mini burger sliders. All of them were really good! In the morning, I had my favourite salmon eggs benedict and freshly brewed coffee. Although my stay was short, it was truly a sweet one!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel In Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Sydneytraveller_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a luxury hotel with first class service with bets location to Marina Bay and shopping

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking!”
Reviews.Author: lemonie01
Reviews.Content: Nothing can compare! If you're going to Singapore, definitely stay at the Fullerton Bay Hotel. The location is great and the rooms are absolutely beautiful. I also can not say enough about the service. Everything was perfect; we even received a room upgrade upon check in to a Premier Bay View Room and a bottle of wine. The room looks exactly the same as the pictures... lots of windows, two balconies, and a super comfy bed. Loved the Molton Brown toiletries. If you like a smaller hotel, you'll appreciate the Fullerton Bay. We looked at a couple other hotels while in Singapore and determined the Fullerton to have the best location and size. It's also really new - the tile floor in the lobby is beautiful... I wonder if I could source it for my house? Breakfast is included; it's pretty typical with an omelette station, fresh fruits, pastries, noodles, meats, etc. What makes it great is the staff is so accommodating if you want something that isn't in the buffet. They also make wicked espresso and iced coffees. If you get the chance, take in a sunset up at The Lantern. It's a chic crowd and the music is loungey. Don't waste your time going for a Singapore Sling at the Raffles which is really touristy. Right beside the Fullerton Bay is the Customs House which has a couple of great restaurants and lounges. I think it's owned by the Fullerton people. Bring your best heels and silk dress! There are no tourists with fanny packs here.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: Traveling-gramps
Reviews.Content: Book a bay view deluxe room with the balcony overlooking Singapore bay and the Marina Bay Sands to watch the light show at night. Drinks or dinner on the roof garden is also worth the view. Hotel staff are some of the best I have ever experienced, they remember your name and great you everywhere in the hotel and make you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, 4.5 stars, skunky room”
Reviews.Author: Maddog111254
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, great location,service. Wonderful breakfast. Room had a musty smell, several others in our group had similar experience. Singapore is hot and humid, they turn A/C off when you leave the room, root of the problem. Put a card in the control when you leave the room will help.

Reviews.Title: “Wow factor in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneAussie1
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent suggested this smaller (by Singapore standards) hotel and she wasn't wrong. It is right on the marina, in fact it is over the water. Our room on the ground floor evn had a plung pool on top of the water! We were a little unsure at first about our ground floor room as we were worried about people being able to see into the room, but the screens and blinds are excellent. The room and whole hotel sets a gold standard for other hotles to aspire to. The staff bent over themselves to help, the rooms are spotless and breakfast delicious. The marvellous thing about this hotel is watching what is happening all around the marina from the festivals to the sound & light show in the hotel on the other side of the marina. Never a dull moment. Loved it and highly recommend. PS the excellent quality tea and coffee pod machine added the icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Freez93
Reviews.Content: We've just stayed 3 nights at this hotel & we loved it! The service was amazing, the staff were so friendly and helpful. The rooms are lovely and have everything you could possibly need. The pool is not overcrowded and they continuously bring around iced water and fruit kebabs whilst your sun baking. Unfortunately from there we went to the Marina Bay Sands which we really regretted as it is so overcrowded around the pool etc. I would really recommend visiting the Marina Bay Sands, buying a day pass so you can go up and use the pool but would definitely stay at the Fullerton Bay Hotel anytime as you really feel like a valued guest.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Disappointing Experience for the Price”
Reviews.Author: maxwell m
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 1 night in a bay view room. The Room had a lovely view, was standard size containing all ammenities we expected. However two little negatives. Firstly the bed although wide enough, was short in length and was too soft for a good nights sleep. Secondly, the airconditioning vent blew air directly onto each person as they slept and the air flow could not be altered. Now these might seem like minor complaints,but I wonder do the designers of these rooms ever actually sleep in them? We also did not receive our morning newspaper and were overcharged by the Hotel on our airport transfer. The breakfast however was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent!”
Reviews.Author: Marsupiali
Reviews.Content: The Fullerton Bay Hotel was a wonderful surprise. The beautiful and imposing decor created an excellent first impression. This was reinforced by the welcoming and efficient check-in. Our room was magnificent - wonderful balcony view over the Marina Bay, first class fittings and decor, beautiful bathroom with picture window, sumptuous bed, free in room wi-fi - the list goes on. Breakfast was equally splendid in both the quality and variety of food and the refined but relaxed surroundings of the ground floor restaraunt. Perhaps the factor that really made our stay so delightful was the efficient and attentive service of the staff in all areas of the hotel. Indeed, many would address you by name. I would unreservedly recommend this hotel for both it's gorgeous ambiance and wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the heart of Marina Bay”
Reviews.Author: gianfranc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Premier Bay View Room with Jacuzzi and to us, it was the best room in the whole hotel. We were offered the Presidential suite after an initial mix up in the booking and after viewing the suite, we still wanted the Premier room with Jacuzzi. Soaking in the jacuzzi, which was right by the bay, and watching the night lights of the Marina Bay area right in front of us was a truly a memorable experience!

Reviews.Title: “LUXURY AND PRIME POSITION”
Reviews.Author: lookingfor7stars
Reviews.Content: Luxurious waterfront botique hotel. We stayed in the Premier Bay View Room which has a large private balcony over the water. For those who are afraid of heights (me) and do not like to be cramped (me) these have the best view, the biggest balcony with 2 sun lounges and are on the first level. Each night around 8pm there is a water, light, and music show which you feel you have front row seats to from your balcony. Reasonably spacioous room decorated in chocolate browns, the most luxurious comfortable bed, sheets, pillows and doona. 2 armchairs and a desk are fitted into the room, the bathroom has an oversized shower, seperate toilet and large bath with tv inbuilt. Daily toiletries are provided, apart from the usual you have a shaver, toothbrushes and toothpase. The hotel was spotlessly clean, dramatic and luxuriously fitted out. Buffett breakfast was very busy around 10am and there were some delays at being seated i would suggest your eat your breaky before 9am, the dining room has a glass wall looking out onto the marina, with full table service if you require it. The rooftop pool and bar was fantastic, many love seats and day beds to lounge around on, 2 jacuzzies, and light meals are available. Satar and Henderson who serviced the pool area were so polite and friendly, nothing at all was too much trouble for them, and i was waited on hand and foot!!!! Singapore is a large city and bustling city, but the Fullerton Bay is positioned in a suprisingly spacious and reasonably peaceful location with boardwalks to the Marina Sands Hotel and shopping centre. It is a 7 minute taxi ride to Orchard Road where you can shop till you drop, about the same to the Singapore Flyer. I found Sinapore to be on the expensive side, and the Fullerton Bay Hotel is not for the economy traveller. I would highly recomend the Fullerton Bay Hotel for the fussy traveller who likes to join in the hussle and bustle and then retire to some peace and quiet in high style.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Experience”
Reviews.Author: woodstockCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fullerton Bay Hotel in Oct. We chose it due to all the reviews, its location & interior decor. We had a superb experience from the time we walked into the hotel until we checked out. I highly recommend to book a bay view room with the balcony which overlooks the stunning view of Marina Bay Sands Hotel, ArtScience Museum and the Louis Vuitton Maison Store. The room is spacious &, spotless. It also provides with complimentary Nespresso coffee. It's a plus! Also, don't miss out the stylish rooftop bar (Lantern) & pool. It's awesome! The staffs are very friendly and helpful. The location is very convenient & only takes about 10 mins walk to the nearest subway station (Raffles Place). I love this hotel and will definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Natalie R
Reviews.Content: I had a bay view room which was spacious and very comfortable. The hotel is in a great location surrounded by great restaurants. The pool is beautiful with great snacks available from the Lantern restaurant. The service from the staff was very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend the buffet breakfast in the Clifford restaurant. Great hotel for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel and rooms, good views”
Reviews.Author: the_stoddarts
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel right on the edge of the Marina with great views from the lantern bar. We paid two visits to the hotel (heading to India inbetween) and on both found the staff to be helpful if a little ‘corporate’ in attitude. We also paid two visits to the Lantern bar – the first on our arrival night and the service was not very good. Our second was on the final afternoon during a downpour and, perhaps due to the lack of other patrons, the service was much better. Our rooms were luxiously appointed and we loved the ‘open outlook’ from the bathroom due to the large glass window over the bath plus the fantasic rain shower. The only issue we had was that we had to check out at 1.00 pm on our final day leaving us with seven hours to fill. We were assured that we would be able to use the ‘changing room’ by the rooftop bar to shower and change in before leaving for the airport. Upon inspection however the ‘changing room’ consisted of a single shower room and a separate toilet, neither with a lot of room nor air conditioning. There were no lockers, hangers or hairdryer as usually provided by a hotel of this calibre. After discussing this with a member of the management team we were informed that changes in this area were planned. Overall a lovely hotel and one we would choose to stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “A great new edition to Singapore's wonderful range of top end hotels”
Reviews.Author: Kathy3197
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights at the Fullerton Bay. It is a top class facility with wonderful staff and top rate amenities. Our room was spacious and comfortable with it's own private deck out onto Marina Bay. We particularly loved the Lantern bar poolside. It was the perfect place to kick back and relax with yummy bar snacks and a nice bottle of wine of an evening and watch the amazing light show put on by the Marina Bay Sands which is opposite the Fullerton Bay across the water. Or we could also watch the show from our room. It is within easy walking distance to Clarke Quay and the Marina Bay Sands for evening dining. There are also a bunch of new restaurants in the Fullerton Heritage area along the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VJHF
Reviews.Content: I stayed on business in September 2011. I loved the hotel. Great rooms with excellent views, not too big a hotel, but above all the service was excellent. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, views, and great service in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: shawntinker
Reviews.Content: The Fullerton Bay Hotel is a fabulously beautiful hotel full of luxury appointments. Our 5th floor room was quite large, the bed was comfortable and the linens sumptuous, the bathroom was large and included a tub and a large separate shower with rain shower head and a separate handheld shower head and a separate toilet area, we had a small balcony overlooking the water (not a great view - see tip for choosing a good room), good design for luggage access, robes and slippers, and so much more! Everything was kept impeccably clean and well maintained. Breakfast for one was included in our room rate and you could get additional for about $40USD. The options were varied and included fresh berries and fruit, cheese, breads that you could toast to your liking, eggs to order, asian options, smoked salmon (my husband's favorite), muesli, and more - you could also order regular (strong) coffee or cappuccinos. We could always get a cab easily to take us anywhere. The hotel staff, including the front desk, the porters, the concierges, etc. - is amazing. They are all without exception friendly and always supremely helpful - they definitely went above and beyond several times, helping us get our clothes washed at a laundry across the street, plan our itinerary, etc. The hotel offers a formal restaurant, a cafe, and light options at the bar on the roof, as well as several excellent restaurants a short walk away. The rooftop is amazing - gorgeous pool and bar with incredible views, especially at night. You can watch the twice-nightly laser and light show over the bay from its perfect vantage point! Finally, it's also just a beautiful, interestingly designed hotel - with lots of views and separate buildings - and all right on the water. Definitely recommend it! Some of my husband's colleagues stayed at the sister hotel, The Fullerton Hotel, which is more traditional and is housed in an old, venerable building of Singapore. The Fullerton Bay is much more modern and is right on the water, which we enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “great property but would need to fine tune a bit more the service aspect.”
Reviews.Author: davidloiseau68
Reviews.Content: overall excellent stay. bay view room well located, spacious and well designed. nespresso machine is always a great addition in the room. service attitude a little bit stiff and systematic...smile will be a plus. great place to stay and will definitel come back.

Reviews.Title: “Colonial Luxury”
Reviews.Author: youngprofessionalUK
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a touch of colonial luxury in Singapore this place will not disappoint - it is sleek and vibrant. The ambiance is retro chic. The roof top swimming pool area and bar are fantastic, and afford beautiful views over the port and the night laser show.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room”
Reviews.Author: quintopino
Reviews.Content: Definitely a good choice for a centrally-located hotel in Singapore. The staff were a bit starched, and it has a distinctly "executive" feel to its version of luxury, but independent of that, the room was exquisitely furnished and decorated and was an extremely comfortable place to stay. For the room alone - 5 stars. The rest of the hotel, as I say, is rather full of its own importance, which I find tiresome, but the roof-top pool was great, the breakfast was first class, and the location is excellent for central Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “The 2nd Part Of Our Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Juanki_Lemonn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in another hotel in Singapore before moving to The Fullerton Bay Hotel. And the bar was set by the previous hotel so we were a tad bit disappointed with our stay. Let me give you a heads up before you book in The Fullerton Bay Hotel. The Bad 1) We were spending our anniversary in Singapore and I wanted to surprise my girlfriend. I got in touch with 2 different people to make flower and wine arrangements to be ready once we arrive. I gave them all my flight details as well. I specifically told them to have it ready when we walk in to our room. Yet when we got in to our room, I saw nothing. I hid my frustration and talked to the receptionist. 2) Our room felt crampy. I don't know if this is because we booked some sort of promo but nonetheless we felt we were set aside. 3) The receptionists were poorly dressed and gave me the feeling that tending to us was an interruption to their chitchat. 4) I'm sorry Fullerton Bay Hotel but your breakfast buffet was horrible. The food was made me frown and thinking about it now makes me cringe. The service was bad too. There as an Australian lady sitting in the table beside us and was shaking her head waiting for a waiter to come over and then waited even longer for her fork. I gave her a smile and said, "Pretty bad huh?" and she went on ranting. We sat together, me, my girlfriend and her and enjoyed some tea. The Good. 1) The view. Some things that you can't really put a price tag on. The view was amazing. Even if we were given a small room at the end of the hallway in front of what I remember to be the fire exit, the view from our room was amazing. 2) In my last review I was singing praises about another hotels shower. But the shower in The Fullerton Bay Hotel was to die for. Rain shower head that would just engulf your whole body, a bathtub good for two persons (although they did not have bath foam readily available) and the tiling was natural stone. 3) The history of the building. I heard it used to be a post office of sorts. And personally, I liked the idea. My imagination went wild once I went in the hotel. 4) They stepped up and pushed through with my request for flowers, letter for my girlfriend (I wrote and emailed to them) and wine and even though I was expecting to pay for it, they did not charge. So there were some bad and some good things in our stay, it all meshed into a so-so experience, I would still recommend the hotel on the thought of maybe we were just unlucky. Oh and before I forget, I let the management know my 2 cents via guest comment card and they were nice enough to send me an email apologizing and inviting me over to prove themselves again. The gesture was well taken and hope other hotels would do the same. Stayed June, 2011 with the love of my life.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels I have had the pleasure of staying at”
Reviews.Author: princessbollinger
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic weekend at the Fullerton Bay, room was stunning, view stunning and the Hotel its self is one of the most beautifully fitted out I have ever seen, leaves its sister hotel lacking. great room top pool area.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel to hold that Extra Special Celebration”
Reviews.Author: DaveTan
Reviews.Content: The Fullerton Bay Hotel (FBH) is an elegant, luxurious boutique hotel that is strategically located at the perimeter of the Marina Bay. My review is primarily focused on the service aspect of the hotel. I will be sharing my experience in a narrative format as follows:- I had planned a surprise birthday party for my wife. The event was celebrated together with a group of close friends. Everything would be done in style - complete with videography & photography, flowers & a slideshow presentation. As such, I had to do some homework – to search for, and making an assessment of a hotel that can work with me to make the event a success. The 2 main selection criteria at the top of my list are (i) Attentiveness to details, and (ii) Superior service. Quality of hotel and adequacy of facilities are a given – these are externally visible and relatively easy to assess. Please view the photos of the hotel that I had taken during my stay at FBH and see for yourself. In the process of making the initial enquiries, the front desk staff came across as warm, friendly and helpful. The Duty Manager offered me a tour of the Premier Bay View room – which is located at an exclusive and quiet section of the hotel. Guests will need to pass through an additional security door to get to this special section of the hotel. There are only 10 of these Premier Bay View rooms, each featuring a spacious balcony where one can take in the spectacular view of the Marina Bay. I visited the FBH 3 times before making a final decision on the venue. In between my visits, I corresponded with the Duty Manager via email and SMS, stating special requirements for the event. The evening agenda went through several revisions. All my questions and concerns were answered in an accurate and timely fashion. During my follow-up visit, the Duty Manager assisted me to test out the room’s audio/visual system with my portable electronic gadgets (for the in-room birthday slideshow presentation to my guests). A technician was brought in to ensure that the sound system is adapted to my personal AV equipment. It took about 20 minutes and everything was fixed & set to go. The level of service extended to me was on par with that given to a company holding a major function at a 5 star hotel. I told the Duty Manager how impressed I was in his handling my special requests, even though I am just an individual (vs. a corporate client), and had not even committed to anything yet at that point. The Duty Manager reassured me that FBH values all its customers – corporate as well as individuals. That sealed the deal for me – I know that I have found the perfect hotel for the special occasion. On the day of arrival, my wife & I were greeted warmly by name. Quite a few of the staff had already known us as a result of my planning. Per the Duty Manager and the Director of F&B, all staff members who were involved in the evening’s agenda had been briefed in advance.
