We were given an early check-in so that my family can enjoy the rooftop pool. The front desk staff had also assisted my wife in securing a booking at a nearby hair-dresser. Later that evening, champagne glasses were brought in at the right timing to surprise the guests. FBH scored full marks for excellence in execution. The evening started with the guests’ arrival at Lantern – the rooftop bar. It was drizzling. The staff at Lantern was attentive and had large umbrellas ready. We were escorted individually from the bar reception area to the sheltered section of the rooftop bar. Orders for the pre-dinner drinks went smoothly. The waiters & waitresses at the Lantern were focused in their jobs & alert to all my guests’ needs. As the pre-dinner drinks session came to an end, the leftover liquor was transferred to the dinner venue – the Clifford restaurant. The seating arrangements at the Clifford were done perfectly according to my specification. Names of guests were correctly typed out on Seating Cards and displayed prominently for everyone to quickly locate their seats at the table. An experienced waiter was deployed to our table and the Restaurant Manager supervised the entire function. The service was impeccable. Glasses were filled promptly; napkins were placed on the laps of guests each time they left & returned to their seats; used dishes & utensils were quickly cleared away at every stage of the meal. The birthday cake was brought out at the precise moment. After the dinner and in-room slideshow presentation, we proceeded back to the rooftop bar and party the night away. The staff members at Lantern seem to be just as attentive and accommodating as they were at the start of the evening. They have an unwavering commitment to ensure that everyone had a great time – and we did! Here’s an extra tip that I wish to share with you:- If you are planning for an event at the hotel, do get to know the friendly hotel staff members in advance. Building an affiliation with the crew goes a long way towards the success of the function. The FBH staff are really nice to work with. I hereby wish to acknowledge the following hotel staff members who had demonstrated remarkable service (a short narration against each of their names represents a mini-review of their individual contributions):- The Duty Manager – Mr. Sadiq: He is my main point of contact and is instrumental in overseeing the planning process. He patiently worked with me on the agenda. He orchestrated the team to ensure seamless execution as we moved from one item on the agenda to the next. Director of F&B – Mr. Sugu: He mobilized his F&B team to extend exceptional service to all my guests. He was personally present on the evening of the event to ensure all systems go, before rushing off for another important appointment. Assistant Restaurant Manager – Mr. Prakash: He coordinated well with the chef, waiters and waitresses to ensure a perfect dining experience at the Clifford. Waiter – Mr. Thong: He did an excellent job as an attentive and competent waiter. All the guests were pleased with him as he displayed pride, passion and enthusiasm in his job. Front Desk Reception - Ms. Yasmin: Facilitated the check-in (and check-out) process and showed us to the hotel room. She arranged for an in-room birthday cake & a soft toy gift for my kids. Her cheerfulness and professional demeanor is an embodiment of the spirit of FBH. She had also made special arrangements for an external hair dresser on my wife’s behalf. Front Desk Reception – Ms. Ifa: She was my first point of contact at FBH, and she made a fantastic first impression. Her warm and friendly greeting will make any potential guest feel welcome at the hotel. The Chef – Tal: He came out of the kitchen and greeted my wife & I. He made sure that the guests are happy with the meal. Restaurant Manager – Mr. Shuren: I met him the next day and he listened attentively to our feedback and took notes on areas for improvement. Guest Services Agent, Concierge – Mr. Paolo: He promptly greeted my family on arrival at the hotel entrance and ushered us to the front desk. Our luggages were handled perfectly. On the day of departure, he escorted us from the lobby to the hotel entrance and bade us a warm farewell. F&B staff at Lantern rooftop bar: I did not have a chance to get their names individually, but every one of them was very attentive to our needs. Last but not least, I wish to extend my heartiest congratulations to the General Manager of Fullerton Bay Hotel, Mr. Giovanni Viterale, for leading this wonderful, world-class team. Fullerton Bay Hotel has my highest recommendation, and I wish that there is one in every country that I travel to. Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, in design, comfort and service quality”
Reviews.Author: Singapore_trav
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at this fine hotel. Situated on the business district, it faces the Marina Bay Sands which lies across the bay and is 15 minutes walk from the shopping mega mall and casino. If you get the bay view as we did, you're in for a treat. The view is especially breathtaking and worth the price if you take the room during the national day parade when the fireworks is right above you. Service is also prompt and polite, though we had to wait a half hour before checking on. We liked how there were many good restaurants in and around the hotel. We also loved how web access was free. The hotel is near attractions like the Singapore Flyer and F1 circuit, when the race is on. A great place and one I'd highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeejTeejTeej
Reviews.Content: Possibly my favourite hotel in Singapore. Very new (I believe) and the rooms are very well furnished and have a little balcony overlooking the bay and the impressive to look at (but not to stay at) Marina Bay Sands Hotel. The pool on the roof was very good and the area becomes an excellent partially covered bar in the evening. Although I was on business (and the hotel is very close to Marina Bay Financial Centre etc.) it was also quite close to the MRT and Orchard (and the shops) is only a few stops away. The service was also good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, a 5 star hotel that lives up to its name”
Reviews.Author: kylelsim
Reviews.Content: The night before I moved to the Fullerton, I stayed in a huge corner suite on the 51st floor of the Marina Bay Sands hotel that had views of both the bay and sea. Yet, in nearly all respects, the Fullerton Bay was superior. The resplendent Bay View Room was right by the edge of the Marina offering a beautiful view of Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore flyer. The room itself was lavishly furnished, with every possible amenity included (though the lack of a bottle/wine opener was odd). A lovely selection of Nespresso Coffee shots (36 in total) made sure caffeine junkies had their fix. The toilet was great, rainshower or normal head in the separate shower, big bathub with bath salts and a television to watch while you soak. breakfast at the clifford restaurant was good. very quiet, no noisy kids running around, nice selection of cheeses cereals, egg station, standard fare but of a slightly higher quality than other hotels. This would be my top choice in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Class. Dilightful”
Reviews.Author: HK_John
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. Little fault found apart from gym... Great for business travellers but not sure if appropriate for a family stay. Check In/Out: Efficient and polite. Food: Excellent quality. All very fresh. Great selection of healthy stuff over the breakfast buffet such as a great selection of fruit. Room service quick and friendly. Room: Excellent size. Latest lighting system which doesn't require a PhD in Engineering. Comfortable bed. Efficient and nice bathroom. Little balcony with a seat to enjoy the view. Gym: On the top floor next to a large rooftop bar. Very small and the machines are extremely close together. Basically only 1-2 of the more traditional machines. One of worse gyms in a five star hotel in Singapore. However if you want to jog or just a brisk walk you can go all around the marina; takes about 25 minutes jogging slowly.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and Awesome View”
Reviews.Author: MajorfoodieSingapore
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with masculine rooms, clean lines and excellent staff. We had a view over the harbour and Marina Bay Sands and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We mentioned that it was our belated Wedding Anniversary and when we returned from dinner a delicious bottle of claret and some beautiful hand made chocolates were waiting for us; a gift from the hotel. Therefore I feel quite churlish when I must mention that the food does not match the rest of the hotel's standards. Both breakfast and lunch at the Lantern Bar were disappointing in quality and quite overpriced. That said, every new hotel has teething problems and this place really is well worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms facing the bay make you feel that you are at a resort and not right by the financial district”
Reviews.Author: siglo
Reviews.Content: The rooms facing the bay make you feel that you are at a resort and not right by the financial district, which makes the location a winner. With 90+ rooms, the overall size is small and ideal if you don't want the hustle and bustle of larger properties, and where privacy and discreetness is at a premium Although the layout of the rooms are conventional, its well embellished with every amenity the business and leisure traveller would want.With quality. Spending time in the room is a pleasure. The view of the bay is calming. The Lantern at the Rooftop is another "away from the city but in the city" experience. The mini wagyu burgers and truffle frites should not be missed. The ambience at sunset is blissful. Breakfast at The Clifford is un-rushed with quality Asian and Western offerings Free wi-fi access throughout the property is another winner Service is also excellent - well done GM! A highly recommended property

Reviews.Title: “This is an outstanding Property”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: My partner and i were staying in Singapore on our way through to Europe on a five week vacation and were pleasantly surprised by this outstanding property. As i travel for work often and stay in Singapore on a regular basis, the Fullerton Bay Hotel truly stands out from some of the others. Every staff member from the bell boy, concierge, reception staff, restaurant staff, were more than exceptional in there delivery of service. The roof top pool and Lantern Bar had an amazing view, great food and was the perfect place to unwind, relax and start our holiday. We will absolutely be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted close to Sands Casino, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Swiss02
Reviews.Content: Fullerton Bay is the little sister of the old Fullerton Hotel that is just down the road, located on the bay, its a much smaller hotel that is more modern and trendy than the old colonial Fullerton. Expecting more of the colonial touches i was slightly disappointing and wished that i had gone for the original rather than the re invented. The service is excellent and friendly, and 'customs house' complex which is next door provides a few nice restaurants and bars. Fantastic breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Nice addition to Singapore Hotel scene”
Reviews.Author: traceller
Reviews.Content: A nice little hotel built right on the water.I did not find the hotel cosey as was described in some of the other reviews, definitely luxurious and classy. I had a room with a deck at water level. The rooms have extremely high ceilings, are luxuriously fitted and work well. I found the guest room corridors in this part of the hotel resembling hallways of a cruise liner, rather narrow and giving it a less luxurious feel. The staff are professional ,a place I can recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarcaBoys
Reviews.Content: Palatial in all respects. Staff are polite and helpful if a little sleepy. Western s staff are a little snobbish though foyer no apparent reason

Reviews.Title: “"Would go out of my way to stay here again"”
Reviews.Author: wilma47_11
Reviews.Content: In Singapore to attend our daughter's wedding hotel and staff exceeded our expectations.From pre wedding party in Post Bar to vintage Rolls hotel and staff contributed greatly to making it a memorable and enjoyable occassion.Building, location and food great but it was the people who were outstanding.Friendly,helpful,efficient and available with exactly the right level of attentiveness which meant service was neither suffocating nor fawning but pitched at exactly the right level as far as i am concerned.These comments applied equally to all staff we encountered from those servicing the room to the front of house.I have stayed in other 5* hotels in Singapore and following this thoroughly enjoyable experience I would go out of my way to stay here again and would unhesitatingly recommend to friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel stay(s) ever”
Reviews.Author: travelmizen
Reviews.Content: We stayed two consecutive weekends at the Fullerton Bay Hotel. The first weekend we were upgraded to the Cavanaugh Suite which is a corner Bay View room on the 6th floor. Amazing luxury with two separate rooms and balconies on two sides of the hotel. The hall between the rooms and had his/her closets and room for suitcases. The bathroom was spacious with glass views through the bedroom to the bay a separate toilet room and large walk-in shower. Off the bedroom was another office nook which could have been an additional bedroom for a child. The living room was well separated from the bedroom which allowed for good privacy while my boyfriend has meetings with colleagues. The next weekend we were back and had a Bay View room on the other corner of the hotel on the 2nd floor. Although not a suite this room was better for us since we didn’t have work meetings to conduct in the room. Instead of the office nook there was a nice long table along one side of the room looking out over the skyline view. We were lucky enough to catch the preview night of the Singapore birthday celebrations on the bay and the view from our balcony was perfect. We also enjoyed the roof-top pool and whirlpools which we often had to ourselves in the late afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED my room with a deck !”
Reviews.Author: goodtrips01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from 4 nights at the FBH. We had a Premier Bay View Room. This means not only do you get a beautiful bay view and a small terrace (like the regular Bay View Rooms) You get a deck with chaise lounge chairs perched a few feet above the marina. You feel like you are on a boat. We would have morning coffee out there every day and nighttime cocktails there every night. (Do be aware that small boats will cruise by very close if you know what I mean) The hotel bar (Lantern) is stunning as is the whole rooftop pool area. The lobby is just beautiful as well. The hotel faces directly at the Marina Bay Sands Hotel which is a stunning view. A nightly 9:30pm laser light show from the Marina Bay Sands is beautiful from the FBH. The workout is is small (2 treadmills, 2 ellipticals , 2 bikes a universal, an incline bench, yoga mats an exercise ball and free weights) but it has a nice view and they keep it stocked with fruit infused water, towels and headphones. We were able to spend an hour or 2 in here every day. The staff were all extremely polite and helpful. The breakfast buffet has a omelet station . We went to Raffles to check it out and have a Sling. WAY WAY happy we didn't stay there. It had a lot of foliage which was nice but that's it. We had lunch at the top of the Marina Bay Sands hotel. Again, WAY happy we didn't stay there. It was like a Las Vegas or Orlando convention hotel...yikes! But it is beautiful to see from afar. I fretted long and hard about restaurant reservations and made a few changes once we got there. If you want a lovely outdoor table by the River with music in the background and good food, I would say IndoChine Waterfront. Ask for a table at the edge and go right before sunset. The pictures actually turn out better at night with the flash off. Then, if you want to try the Chili Crab and want to see a different area (maybe 10 minutes by cab) Go to Jumbo East Coast. Again, try to get a table outside on the edge. It's at East Coast Park where there are several Chili Crab restaurants. This one seems to be a local favorite. It's on the water with a nice promenade for walking by the sea. We happened upon SKI360 there. Its cable water skiing/boarding. It looked fun so we came back early the next morning for an hours session. After that we went to the Maxwell Food Center for the Tian Tian Hainanese Chicken Rice for lunch. I think it must help if the dish transports you back to your childhood or something. It's not bad; it's just rice and chicken with some condiments. I know it's very touristy, but we took one of the night boats on the River. It's only about 30 minutes but you get commentary on the buildings and history. At night it's gorgeous. That's the most I can offer. If you want a really fancy elegant hotel room pick the St Regis. But if you like a bit of modern minimalist with great views and cool rooftop bar go to the FBH. We loved every second we were there .

Reviews.Title: “One of Singapore's best”
Reviews.Author: AndMat
Reviews.Content: On a recent business trip to Singapore I was fortunate enough to spend the night at The Fullerton Bay Hotel. Wow, this hotel is sensational. Rooms are extremely good, super comfy bed, great views of the Marina Bay area and some great restaurants. The rooftop bar and pool are fantastic, a great place for a drink after a days work. Service was excellent, definately think it is one of Singapore's best.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and highly memorable, am in love with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: gracetay
Reviews.Content: Had a staycation at this hotel as a surprise from my husband for our wedding anniversary - as such, I may be biased due to the fond occasion and memories of it, but I do believe my great impressions of this hotel are well justified. There are few other lobbies in the many hotels I've stayed in that has taken my breath away as this place does. Beautiful glittering mosaic tiles, grand chandeliers and their specially curated scent wafts through the air. Staff were polite and extremely hospitable. The rooms were a treat, luxurious and contemporarily designed, with Molton Brown toiletries, a view of the Marina Bay skyline (which may not apply for all rooms), a Nespresso machine that we fully abused, and extremely thoughtful touches like a bathtub caddy, laptop handrest and so forth. As locals, we ventured out to our familiar haunts for food instead of dining in the hotel, although the Lantern bar that is perched by the beautiful pool would be a hit if only for the amazing view. Considering the needs of tourists or foreign visitors, I would definitely recommend a stay at the Fullerton Bay Hotel even if it isn't located within the popular shopping belt. Its a short cab ride away from shopping areas, museums and gives you an alternative point of view of the CBD crowd. Not to mention a short stroll takes you to Customs House or One Fullerton where there is Starbucks, and great restaurants like Overeasy and Kinki - and of course, the Merlion which I suppose would be a great tourist haunt to indulge in. The only drawback - would be the layout of the hotel that has some sections facing inwards that renders the walkways dark at times. Also, being perched on a waterfront of a sea of water that isn't exactly blue and crisp but a little muggy and 'green' instead, it does affect the overall aesthetic of the hotel, albeit an uncontrollable factor.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and I will send executive travel clients to this hotel with confidence”
Reviews.Author: AskMariaTodd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top notch. As the CEO of a health travel logistics company that coordinates high net worth individual executive checkups, I did an impromptu reservation without any fanfare. I discovered that I can send clients to this hotel in total confidence that they will enjoy their stay, their surroundings, and receive the class of service for which this hotel is known. I don't have to belabor stiff contracts with them, they just do the right things.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, One of the Best in the World!”
Reviews.Author: pek1
Reviews.Content: The Fullerton Bay in one of the best hotels I have stayed in and that is saying a lot. You can pay thousands of Euro's for great service or simply come to the Fullerton Bay. Upon arrival, I was warmly greeted by Ifa and Henderson. After a quick check-in, I was shown to my room and all the features were explained. The room was absolutely gorgeous, quite possibly the best design I have seen so far! Even tough the room was great, the staff were absolutely amazing! Front Desk agents always remembered my name and used it, when I was walking by. The evening doorman acknowledged that I was a hotel guest and gave me priority taxi service. The Bar Manager in the Landing Point/Lantern always recognized me and provided fantastic service. The seating hostess at Lantern remembered me from an evening at Lantern, greeted me by name as I was enjoying the pool and offered to make another reservation for Lantern. As I was late for my 3rd evening reservation at Lantern, they had no table and were then apologetic about providing me with what I thought was the best table in the house (the private elevated table near the DJ). Overall, all the staff at Fullerton Bay were amazing! I have only experienced this level of VIP treatment when staying in a Ritz-Carlton Presidential Suite. It is absolutely amazing that they can make all guests feel like VIP's! Cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Select premier room or up, not deluxe”
Reviews.Author: soryu1937
Reviews.Content: I had little preparation before reserving this hotel and the trip to Singapore, so I settled with deluxe room, with the lowest rate. The room was stylish and spacious, equipped with all the good amenities provided in other rooms such as nespresso and wide selection of Gryphon tea. I especially loved a BOSE speaker set in which you could connect your iPod and enjoy the music I brought with me. However, deluxe rooms are NOT harbor view. I thought it was alright.....until the night fell. The room is great in the morning and afternoon, but never after 6 p.m. There are open-air bars and restaurants in adjaceant Customs House... you could see them from your room. The sound of booming music from stereo sets and people's loud voice and giggling could be heard until late at night. I stayed a Friday night and was literally attacked by the sound coming from an open-air party held on the building's roof which went on until around midnight. Otherwise I've enjoyed most of my stay, including a brief bartime at Lantern, rooftop hermitage with superb view of the marina. It is only a few minutes walk from Raffles Place MRT station and traditional Hawker station Lau Pa Sat is also 5-minutes walk away, where I enjoyed exotic foods.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, boutique, peaceful, gorgeous pool, great service”
Reviews.Author: babyvic
Reviews.Content: After the busy tourist trap world at Marina Bay Sands, the fullerton Bay was like a paradise. the rooftop pool, with the sunloungers inside it, the service, the friendliness of the staff, made for a much more peaceful weekend break after a week of work in Singapore. The rooms are amazing and the hotel is ideally located also

Reviews.Title: “Incredible achitechure, beautiful hotel, but some mishaps...”
Reviews.Author: annaluvs2travel
Reviews.Content: When I first walked into the hotel, my mouth dropped. It was spectacular. The staff was extremely pleasant and very accommodating. There were two things that happened during my very brief stay at the hotel. First, we asked the concierge to recommend a couple restaurants that would be "unforgettable" the first one she suggested was TGI Fridays, and the second was supposedly the best Thai food restaurant in town. We opted for the Thai food (obviously) and we went to the mall in which this restaurant was located. However, the restaurant had been closed down for months. After we returned back to our room, housekeeping had brought back some clothes we asked to be pressed. One of them was a dress that I had just purchased the day before and the other was a collared shirt. They brought both items back not pressed with tape all over them. The shirt was ripped and the dress had stains on them. They had ripped the tags off the dress so even if I were to try and return it I could not and they offered no explanation as to why the clothes were the way they were. These items were NOT given to them in that way and all they kept doing is pointing out the stains and the rip. I was honestly speechless. A couple other things, the pool is beautiful but there are only 8 sunbeds which for a luxury resort makes no sense. Those 8 beds were all taken by 10 a.m. The bathtub in the room had hair and dust all along the top of it. All in all, definitely a beautiful, relaxing and comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RazzaVictoria
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at The Fullerton and would highly recommend it. We had a wonderful experience there. They made you feel very special. From the check in staff who were able to check us in even though we arrived at 7.30 am, through to the cleaning staff. Especially Roy who went out of his way to get us more tea and a bucket of ice. There is no doubt that we will stay there again. The pool was relaxing, an infinity pool overlooking the park. We had a balcony that looked over the bay to the Marina Bay Sands. Rooms were quiet and elegant. Location was great. Even though in finance district two minutes walk to Boat Quay and five minutes to Raffles Place station. As the breakfast was a little expensive we walked to Raffles Place to the Coffee Club which had beautiful breakfasts at reasonable price. On the other hand we had dinner in room one night and it was reasonable and beautiful food.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing decor and clean, pool is packed.”
Reviews.Author: jklove
Reviews.Content: Hotel is modernly and lavishly decorated, the room is spacious and comfortable. The room is very user friendly and the size and the fittings of the bathroom is allow you to spend a good deal of time taking shower or having a bubble bath while watching the TV. Amazing choices of tea and a nespresso machine is also available. Love the balcony which provides some fresh air although the view and the stuffy air outdoor is not utterly impressive. The pool area is only average given that this is a new establishment, you get a normal pool and a terribly small jacuzzi area (can barely stretch your legs if there are more than 2 people), service is not friendly. The food and drinks in this hotel is below average, so look elsewhere for some quality food!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favourite places to stay”
Reviews.Author: AlexSmith75
Reviews.Content: The FBH is a great hotel and a pleasant alternative to the Singapore stalwarts (Raffles, Fullerton). It's modern, fresh, and excellently staffed with great facilities, including the rooftop Lantern Bar with great views over the Marina. I normally stay here on business and go for the basic (very good value) rooms but some of the ones with bay views are worth the extra investment. All rooms are very well equipped, and the bathrooms are great. The restaurant is also a good breakfast experience. My one piece of advice - keep the chain on the door; the service staff have a strange tendency to walk into your room at all hours of the day (whether you have the DND sign on or not!).

Reviews.Title: “It was really amazing........”
Reviews.Author: Tejassejpal
Reviews.Content: actually my one freind was staying when i was in singapore so i lived with him for two days and it was really so amazing,the services and the hotel infrastructure and the food was really fantastic,i really enjoyed very much when i will go back to singapore i will visit and stay over there its sure....

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Boutique hotel in Marina Bay waterfront”
Reviews.Author: OutkastBCN
Reviews.Content: Fullerton Bay hotel is an elegant beautiful boutique hotel in Raffles Quay, close to othe Fullerton propieties like Fullerton ONE and the old classic Fullerton hotel with excellent views on Marina Bay area. The hotel design is very impressive and its decor is rich and bold with a mix of asian and italian modern elements. The rooms are very spacious, comfortable with lots of details and tech elements and have outstanding views on marina bay skyline. On the top floor there is an mazing swimming pool, outdoor jacuzzi, gym and bar-restaurant all with impressive views on Marina Bay Skyline. Service is very good. Fullerton Bay provides a luxury boutique experience in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent luxury hotel with magnificent rooftop pool and spa area”
Reviews.Author: AdelaidianTraveller
Reviews.Content: This is a new luxury hotel. It offers superior service, luxury accommodation, high quality business facilities, within an opulent environment. A highlight is the superb rooftop pool area, with secluded couples spa pools, a large pool and attractive gardens. The view overlooks the waterfront and Sansa Casino. An excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Outstanding Customer Service...”
Reviews.Author: eightblack
Reviews.Content: I live in SIN so I am critical of our hotels. But there is one exception. The Fullerton Bay. Went there with my wife last night as I wanted to take her to experience their fabulous wine and cheese offering. In the past, the FBH used to put on an amazing array of imported cheeses, all beautifully arranged on a centre display. It was on offer Fri/Sat/Sun evenings, from 6pm to 9pm. Wine was also included. Call up yesterday to even make a reservation. Ask the nice lady if the wine and cheese option in the lobby is still running. Yes, came the reply. When we get to the hotel, I am saddened to see no magnificent display of fromages. But I did notice quite a few people eating to what appeared to be a "high-tea" selection of food, all well presented on a little 3-tier tray. I mentioned my disappointment to the staff and said that we may not eat there now but would head to the rooftop to take a look around (as my wife had not been here before). We decide to have a drink upstairs and enjoy the view and the terrific atmosphere. Moments after we order, I receive a phone call from the Assistant Director of F&B for the hotel. He asks me if he can come and talk to me - and that he would be right up. No more than 5 minutes later, he introduces himself. He apologised profusely for the change in the wine and cheese offering (which was still being offered by the way, but it was now served to you and not self selection) and then said "let me take care of these drinks for you". Stunned, but grateful, we accepted his goodwill gesture. We told him we would be more than happy to come downstairs to try out their new offering. The staff could not have been more efficient, friendly and professional. The service was impeccable, the wine and cheese selection excellent (and terrific value) and their desire to make amends was above and beyond the call of duty. Another staff member insisted we try out a new cocktail they were due to release next month. Again, no charge. I'm not going to publicly name the F&B Director of the Fullerton Bay Hotel, but he was one of the best hotel operators I have seen. A consummate professional. I know its not the cheapest hotel in SIN, but in my mind, it's clearly the best. Simply outstanding customer service. Which is rare these days. Bravo to the FBH. And many thanks for a wonderful evening.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: msun4
Reviews.Content: Having had no luck with "children-friendly" hotels on Santosa, we opted for a city hotel. The Fullerton Bay Hotel has only 6 rooms with terrace, they are located on the ground floor just over the water. The weather was perfect for an after dinner drink on the terrace and offered additional space for the kids to play after sun-set. The view was wonderful as we caught nightly light-shows just across the bay at Sands hotel. This hotel is truly a 5-star in terms of amenities and service. Two downside (and this could perhaps be due to easter holiday) was the difficulty to get taxis. We often had to wait for door-men to call for taxis, even then, the wait was roughly 5-7mins. Again, might have just been the holiday quietness in the city. Also, the beds were super soft, so if you're used to sleeping on harder beds, you might find the lack of back support disagreeable. Thou a city hotel, they catered well to young children.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed in Asia”
Reviews.Author: jonjon97
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, the Fullerton Bay is one of the finest hotels I've stayed in Asia. It is easily as comfy as any of the "spa hotels" that I've stayed -- Amanpuri, Four Seasons in Sayan, etc. -- but so much more stylish! The bed is sooo comfortable -- I would buy one for my bedroom! I also spent a lot of time hanging out by the rooftop pool & bar, which has sweeping views of the marina bay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and well presented”
Reviews.Author: rodders70
Reviews.Content: Only a one night stay after five nights at a so called exclusive hotel. The difference FBH and the other is simply that one lives by an old reputation and the FBH simply delivers. The rooms are beautiful and modern. We had a Marina view and it was great for watching the night show lights of the Sands across the water. We had drinks at the Lantern and this again was great. Beautiful views and great drinks with attentive staff (with the noticeable exception of the blonde maitre d' who was quite rude to my wife when informed we did not have a reservation - could have been handled so much better!) Perhaps the best quality of this hotel was the staff (except of course the blonde maitre d' at Lantern!) They were great and greeted my wife and I by name. They extended genuine welcomes and were very accommodating. The stand out was Lynette - she made our stay and is a credit to this chain - thank you. Breakfast is as expected in a hotel of this quality - smaller range than bigger chains but quality nonetheless. Staff again were excellent. If you are after great quality and genuine service, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: SJS1977G
Reviews.Content: It was our first stay at Fullerton Bay Hotel and I must say that we absolutely loved it! The hotel is incredibly beautiful (not your typical oversized 5-star hotel but rather intimate). Staff are friendly and attentive and there are excellent options for wining & dining. The rooftop bar must be the sexiest alfresco spot in Singapore. We enjoyed a first-class wagyu burger from the in-room dining menu and next day's breakfast was very good as well. Once again service was polite and attentive and the buffet selection was a good example for "quality over quantity". Altogether a very enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Emma H
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night at The Fullerton on my way back to Hong Kong. As I walked into our room I nearly fell over - it was just beautiful and the attention to detail is impeccable. Swimming pool not very big but lovely nevertheless

Reviews.Title: “great hotel to watch the fireworks”
Reviews.Author: daydee123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last December for New years eve fireworks and it was a perfect choice. It worth it, even for extra dollar I had to pay for the new years eve alone. The coffee machine was excellent. I have stayed in many 5 stars hotel but this coffee machine is the best one. My husband even jokingly said if he could take it home The choice for buffet breakfast was limited. to bad for this high class hotel. But in 2nd day, we realized that the table beside us had different breakfast. It turn out, you can order many other menu aside from the buffet. Too bad I already ate when I know it. But my son ordered it. The staff is ok. Not as friendly as staff in a resort hotel, but adequate. This is a business hotel. quite far from shopping center, atracttion places. But MRT station is in walking distance, less then 10 minutes. I would like to stay here again someday, when there is a fireworks again.

Reviews.Title: “Your WOW factor will soon fizzle out - not so great”
Reviews.Author: FRANK11528
Reviews.Content: Stayed at FBH in early February 2011 for 5 nights with my wife to attend a conference in Singapore. The welcome was great and the in-room check in in our Bay View room was efficient and friendly. As we wondered about to inspect the property we took the lift to the roof where the pool and "The Lantern" outdoors restaurant/cafe are located. Beautiful spot indeed, so we took a table wanting to order drinks as it was around 3.30pm. A nice cold beer or coktail in such surrounds would be just fantastic. After about 15 mintes waiting we had to ask for a menu as nobody came although the restaurant staff were loitering there. Two menus were put on our table but nobody bothered to come back to take our orders even after waiting for 30 minutes. So we walked. Quite disgusting really. We had the Bay View Room which overlooks the spectacular Marina Bay Sands complex. The room was small and had a balcony opening up to the bay. However, when you are out at the balcony you will only get cigarette smoke from your neigbours upstairs, down stairs, right and left. Oh yes, it is not a smoke free hotel. The breakfast was boring, boring, boring and to make matters worse, for the 5 nights we were there, there was no change in the menu. Except for an Assistant Manager who was extremely helpful and went out his way to make our stay more pleasant, I would not go back to this hotel as there are many more better ones in Singapore. For those who wish to get the experience to stay at a so called boutique hotel and stay for one night only, it is not too bad. But don't stay for too long. It was an interesting experience for us and I would still rate it as a good hotel but feel it is highly overrated. There ar at least 6 to 10 hotels in Singapore better than FBH at the same price points.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: 71travel10
Reviews.Content: Never have I experienced such a high standard of service. I was at breakfast and ran into a couple that I stopped and chatted to for about 5 minutes, whilst holding my hot breakfast. Before reaching my table the waiter replaced my plate with exactly what I had on it, but hot! This experience does not even take into account the beautiful hotel that even smells great. Love it and will return for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: PegususPerth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definately five star and better than all expectations. We stayed for two nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room we stayed in was very large with a large balcony. It has all the bells and whistles and they are endless. This includes things like a tv above the bath, three phones, an expresso machine, a glassed door fridge, fantaxtic bathrobes and plentiful amenities. The best aspect of all is just how comfortable the bed is and the most comfortable we have ever slept in. The only negative was the response we got from our one and only call to the service staff. We had not recieved any milk portions after our room had been made up on the second day and called to ask for some, we were told that they would get some to us straight away but we are still waiting. Breakfast was also a treat, with silver service in a beatiful setting. Although there was not a great choice it was plentiful but the quality was excellant. The roof top pool was stunning and service there was really tops, the young man looking after the towels did a stirling job. We were disappointed that neither of the two spas were warm. This hotel is really wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Just like dating a Supermodel”
Reviews.Author: JayODHK
Reviews.Content: Staying at The Fullerton Bay Hotel is like dating a supermodel, she's so beautiful that you can almost forget all the dumb stuff she does First, the beautiful - the lines are clean & sleek, yet everything is comfortable (it has a rich & luxurious minimalism). Location is ace too (for me, Singapore eats are #1 & both the Lau Pa Sat & Gluttons Bay hawker centres are walkably close for that late fix). Black out shades & nice, heavy doors (along with the black carrot cake & a couple Tigers) guarantee a good sleep. Now the dumb - and just like a supermodel, most of the dumb stuff happens in the bathroom. The bath design is beautiful but completely brain-dead, non-functional: 1) you must stand deep inside the shower to turn it on, guaranteeing a hot or cold dousing from either the handheld or the rainhead; 2) there is no room to fit your hands under the sink faucet to wash them unless you slide them flat against the basin; 3) if you turn the water in the sink on more than 1/4 of the way, the water will shoot right out of the basin into your lap making you look like you just peed yourself (not great on those romantic getaway weekends); 4) directly over the toilet is a huge & completely necessary picture frame holding a giant gold apple, if you are taller than 5'5" you will hit your head on it every time you bend over to press the button to flush (every time!) Service was friendly, but we made 2 requests, including a fairly urgent one (even in low crime Singapore) to fix a terrace door that would not lock, and both were ignored. Again, style also has to have some service & substance behind it. The rooftop pool is lovely (the view of the Marina Bay Sands when the elevator doors open is stunning) but it serves more as decoration to the surrounding bars & restaurants than as a functioning pool for guests. All but 2 of the loungers are located directly in the pool, which guarantees sopping towels & any accidents involving cel phones, iPods/Pads, or Blackberries will be fatal (to the device, if not necessarily you). Umbrellas are available only over the restaurant/bar tables. The only other lounging option is an uncomfortable wicker cabana-type contraption, which, I can attest, holds the Singapore heat really well. Despite the problems, it is still a very, very good hotel - enjoy the beauty, have a good time, but just like with that supermodel, until she gets a little bit smarter you probably won't fall in love

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: ST1982
Reviews.Content: Having arrived unwell and without my bags, the hotel staff could not have been nicer or more helpful - one of the butler staff even gave me her mobile number to contact her out of hours should I need any help! This is my 1st time in Singapore and staying at the Fullerton Bay was the ideal way to start. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean. The bathroom amenities were fantastic and covered everything I needed until my bags turned up. The facilities at the hotel are also very good. I'm not sure about the the swimming pool set up, as it is right next to the rooftop bar. Otherwise, everything about this hotel is great. Would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel but service has some way to go”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrs_snuffles
Reviews.Content: After a few days at the Ritz Carlton, Mr and Mrs Snuffles fancied a change of pace. The Fullerton Bay is the new kid in town - it is hip, whereas the Ritz is elegant, and has a beautiful roof top bar. The rooms are cool but comfortable and the Snuffles had a great night's sleep. Unfortunately the service is not as smooth as one would expect from a hotel positioning itself as 5* and the quality of the cocktails and the food were not quite up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: BigSamuelLee
Reviews.Content: We come for dinner at Clifford we see the main lobby is nice and the staff here friendly and one staff I like is tall big black guy I can't see his name but I know the name start with sh... He is good from mian to the end we are Singaporean I like to come there again keep up the good work

Reviews.Title: “Ideal and comfortable stay with great bayview and excellent services”
Reviews.Author: rexson
Reviews.Content: Totally enjoyed the bayview at the room balcony, decor of the room is cosy and classy, many selection of complimentary tea/coffee, ideal bed and linen and even the shower is quite a unique design. As it was an important day for me to ask for my partner's hand, really thankful for the hotel staffs in coordinating with me on the flower and in room dining setting arrangement at the balcony!

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: joshlty
Reviews.Content: stayed in a room next to the water, the view was magnificent, especially at night. the room decor was exquisite, and the amenities were wonderful and very high end. bathroom is also one of the best designed i've ever seen. good for a getaway stay, but unfortunately no nearby shopping.. though many choices of high end eateries within 1 kilometer distance. must try the rooftop poolside for some rest and relaxation!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous 'product', horrible service”
Reviews.Author: theletterzee
Reviews.Content: To celebrate our first wedding anniversary, we booked a Premier room. We arrived for our 1 night stay at 3.30pm (check-in time is 2pm). However when we reached, we were kept waiting for 10 min only to find that our request for 1 king size bed was not possible because those rooms were full. The only available bedding type was 2 single beds. Of course we weren't pleased - 500 bucks for a five star luxury experience and this is what we get? Especially since we booked directly with the hotel, a month ago. The staff wouldn't budge and 3 different people came to speak to us one after another, which I find impolite. One person to attend to each guest is way more reflective of attentive service. This was no luxe service. The hotel finally budged and gave us an upgrade to bay view rooms which were spacious and had great touches eg. Nespresso machine, Molton brown toiletries and Egyptian cotton sheets. Breakfast the next morning again showed how dire service levels are - a simple tea order was mixed up, plates took forever to be cleared - and another thing I find most lacking is, staff do not exude hospitality. Check in staff were civil at best, and even as you walk around the hotel staff rarely greet you with even a smile, let alone a 'good afternoon'. We're never coming back to this place again as hotel guests - but will return to enjoy the hotel's stunning interiors & great view.

Reviews.Title: “Plush Hotel, Location Not Ideal”
Reviews.Author: BENLEE123
Reviews.Content: The Fullerton Bay Hotel is a new 5star luxury hotel and just opened last year. It’s the sister property of the iconic Fullerton Singapore just across the street, except it’s more boutique and contemporary. I had a one day transit in Singapore and decided to try out the hotel. Arrival I took a cab from the airport to the hotel, making sure to emphasize to the taxi driver that it’s the new Fullerton Bay, not the old Fullerton. The grumpy taxi driver must have quarreled with his spouse the previous night or something because he was pulling a stony long face all throughout the journey. Fortunately the welcome at the hotel was way more pleasant. Upon arrival, a friendly lady staff escorted me to the check-in desk. On the way, I couldn’t help but noticed the posh surroundings and several attractive chandeliers in the hotel. Check-in was swift and as promised, the hotel upgraded me to a Premier Bay View room. The Room The so-called Premier Bay view room is actually the same as the standard room except there is a large outdoor balcony with two cabana long chairs for relaxation and enjoyment of the “view”. Talking about the view, the room faces Marina Bay, right opposite to the newly opened Marina Bay sands with it’s three tower and a “floating boat” on top ( see photo ). However, the exact same view is available right outside the hotel and at the rooftop swimming pool. In fact, the location of the hotel is right at the edge of Marina bay. So I am not sure if it is worth paying the premium if it doesn’t come with a free upgrade. The design of the room is rather basic and standard. There’s a “see-thru” bathroom with a rainforest shower and deep soaking tub. A writing desk at one corner, a sofa area at the other and a king Size bed. There is a cupboard for clothes but no walk-in closet. A 40” LCD TV with DVD player and a Bose iPod dock round up the entertainment system. As mentioned earlier, the design is very conventional, nothing innovative or ground-breaking. However, the furnishing of the room is first class, with good quality material used throughout that makes the room feels very posh and luxurious. The in-room technology is also good. Wireless internet connect effortlessly and there are an abundance of power plugs and multimedia connection. Another nice thought is the Nepresso coffee machine with 9 selections of coffee granules and 6 more variety of tea, all complimentary of course. The room is very comfortable and I feel relaxed in it. The high thread count bed linens are sumptuous and the bed is soft, a bit too soft actually for me. The bathroom water pressure is good and the provided Molton Brown toiletries are a nice touch. Even the towels and bathrobes are very fluffy. However, I do not like the sink, a single vanity that is way too shallow so that water splash everywhere during use. The ceiling is higher than normal ( I think 3.5m at least ) so it feels large and spacious. Common Areas and Location The hotel has a western restaurant and two bars. There is also a rooftop bar + swimming pool + gym that has 360Deg view of the Marina bay area. The common areas are nicely decorated, and most eye-catching is the check-in lobby with it’s soaring height and huge glass chandelier. Here comes the most problematic area of the hotel, which unfortunately, the hotel couldn’t do much to change or improve. It’s location. It’s situated in the business district of Singapore so during the weekends, everything is closed including restaurants so there’s not much to explore. There’s a underground mall ( Marina Bay Link ) a short walk away which contains some cafes and restaurants and a super market. If one is prepared to walk, the Marina shopping area is within 15mins walking distance but under Singapore’s humid 33 Deg weather? No thanks. The nearest subway station is few blocks away, but one has to cross a dangerous road junction and pass thru some unpleasant construction sites. This is in sharp contrast to the other Singapore hotels I have tried that are located in Marina Bay area or Orchard Road as right outside the hotel’s doorstep are a wide selection of shopping and eating places. In comparison, the Fullerton Bay feels very secluded. Sure, cabs are available but it’s an added inconvenience and for any long stay, the cost adds up. Service Service is generally speaking, good and prompt. All service calls were attended immediately and there was no waiting. Only exception was at the roof top bar where the waitor couldn’t understand English well and the nuts only came after I had finished my beer. Also tried room service for both dinner and morning breakfast ( since I had a early plane to catch ). The dinner is fine, which is basically food ordered at the western restaurant but delivered via in-room dinning to my room. Not outstanding by any standards but decent quality although the price is expensive. Breakfast was poor. They forget the orange juice and the pasteries and bread were all cold and not fresh. If the room rate didn’t include breakfast, it will be S$40/=. F&B is certainly not a strong suit of this hotel. Conclusion The Fullerton Bay hotel is a good choice provided you don’t mind the relatively secluded location. The room has great comfort factor and are posh and luxurious. The hotel’s common areas are impressive. The service needs polishing but otherwise decent. Overall, I rate it a 4 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Grandstand view for the new year Fireworks 2011”
Reviews.Author: Jihadi_San
Reviews.Content: We check-in on new year's eve 2010/11 to witness ourselves the tremendous transformation of the place into what it is today - ultra-luxurious. The hotel rooms (Premier & Bay View Rooms) provide guest with a 'grandstand' view of the new year fireworks display at midnight ! And we certainly enjoyed every moment staying at The Fullerton Bay Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.......pool area needs proper sunloungers”
Reviews.Author: MOZBOB
Reviews.Content: The Fullerton Bay Hotel is a very nice hotel. The rooms are well thought-through with high-quality amenities & furniture and a lot of attention for detail. Breakfast choice was of good quality but not anything outstanding. The major downside for us was the beautiful pool area that had practically no proper sun-loungers available. You could either choose from loungers right in the pool that soaked half your towel, or far too small and short round double-loungers. This lack of loungers made us even go to the very busy Fullerton Hotel for sunbathing the next day, which is a real pity considering a good pool area is important for us. The pool area on the roof is stunning, if only they would allow their guest to sunbathe there instead of only using it as bar or lunch area etc.....

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Beentheres_10
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in great location. Fabulous dump shower. The safe was neatly located in an accessible drawer. Also had multi power adaptor points so no need to take your adaptor. Staff were friendly and helpful. Chairs and tables in the Clifford could be spaced further apart. We loved the decor and style of furnishing in the public areas. Give it a try you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, Luxurious Hotel with Fabulous View.”
Reviews.Author: ashkelee
Reviews.Content: As you stride through the luxurious, spacious lobby, the sense of elegance and comfort strikes you. It is probably the hotel with the best location in Singapore right now, with a most beautiful view that few can rival and the most gorgeous design to complement its status of luxury hotel. Stayed in the Marina Bay View Room, and it was worth every single dollar I forked out. The spotlessly clean floor-to-ceiling window affords one an expansive view of the Marina Bay, with a balcony extension to boot. My friend loved the TV in the bathroom, perfect for being entertained while soaking in the spacious bathtub. The swimming pool was another wonderful experience. I don't usually use hotel pools, but once I saw how inviting it was, I knew I had to use it. And boy, it was worth the sunburn I had after it. It was private, peaceful.. with a beautiful view of the marina bay and the surrounding Singapore skyline. The only drawback would be the scarcity of deck chairs - only 6. Breakfast at the Clifford was decent. Slightly lacking in variety but the quality was decent. What I like was that they actually had eggs benedict (which is my all-time favourite brunch food). All in all, the hotel room was so wonderful that we almost did not want to leave the hotel! As with some of the previous reviews, there was some slight glitches in the service. Which, to their credit, was rectified promptly and sincerely. That said, I will definitely return again as I believe that their service will only improve with time and constant feedback.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but Not So Great Servce”
Reviews.Author: JamesWYC
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, well designed room with nice view. Bed is the best, shower is good too, and we love the complimentry coffee in room with so many choice. The only set back is the service, news paper not delivered, phone call not answered proper and the front desk sfaff need more training too.

Reviews.Title: “Setting New Standards For Hotels in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: JTen10
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in all 5-star hotels in Singapore, we decided to give the sister hotel of Fullerton a try. What a gem it is! The wondferful decor says it all. Watching the moon rise from the rooftop swimming pool is something not to be missed. The bed, my goodness, the best I have ever slept in throughout my extensive business and leisure travels in the world. Go give it a try and you will know what I mean.

Reviews.Title: “Set to become an outstanding hotel!”
Reviews.Author: basilpaw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a night at the Fullerton Bay Hotel and overall thought it was a fabulous, stunning hotel which definitely has the potential to live up to and exceed it's 5 star rating. At present, I'd say the hotel is experiencing a number of teething problems within the service area. On one hand this is fair considering the hotel has only been in operation for three months, but on the other, would expect things to be 110% perfect considering the all round exorbitant prices. We found a couple of things disappointing. The service and quality of food served at the roof top bar/pool and the service at Cliffords restaurant. Seated by the pool my husband waited almost 40 minutes for someone to ask whether or not he would like another beverage, very poor considering it was a quiet weekday afternoon. Lunch was a further source of mild vexation, with the club sandwich coming in at $30 for two paltry, double layered, triangle sandwiches comprising "processed chicken" amongst other things. At Clifford's, the service appeared amateur with wine and water glasses being left too long before being replenished and almost by ourselves at one point. Simply put, there was a severe lack of "attention to detail" by the wait staff. The encouraging thing, is that both these incidents can easily be rectified with astute staff, good tutelage, experience and time. We will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very ordinary...cous cous tasted like”
Reviews.Author: bry_sg
Reviews.Content: I had lunch with two people (one is a senior travel agent visiting from Sydney) and wanted to take them to the new Cliffon restaurant at The Fullerton Bay Hotel. We ordered the lamb and cous cous special. The cous cous literally tasted like soap and all three of us sent it back. The service is also below par for such an establishment. For example, we ordered bottled water and it took 15 min to arrive. Pretty simple stuff yet the staff does not seem to get it...

Reviews.Title: “The Fullerton Hotel, Singapore”
Reviews.Author: TheRolfes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing, pure luxury in the high rise centre of Singapore. Walking distance to lots of attractions, although not recommended due to heat and humidity(cabs available from hotel entrance). The infinity pool was perfect for a relaxing cool down in the evening. The hotel was hosting several business events and weddings but this did not at all impact on the service and ambience of this fantastic hotel, would love to return but maybe the Marina Bay Sands Hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID UNTIL THEY HAVE GOT THROUGH TEETHING AND PERFORMANCE PROBLEMS”
Reviews.Author: StevePeters64
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked into this hotel for a family getaway in our home town for our 11th wedding anniversary and for the young kids to watch the fireworks for the opening ceremony of the youth olympic games. I watch blown away by the beauty and splendour of the hotel when I arrived at 2.55pm. I so wanted to love this place. We were checkin to one room and told to wait for the other two rooms. After numerous call and complaints we got our rooms at 530pm. 3.5 hours after checkin time. There are some staff at this hotel who were quite rude -lack of EQ here. I later found out 7 others rooms were delayed similarly in a 130 room hotel with 15 cleaners. Something very wrong here. On check out they gave me an invalid parking ticket so I had to walk 400m back from carpark to get a new one. At least this time the guy apologise sincerely. As I said to the manager, I look forward to their firm rebuttal. In summary Beautiful hotel with poor performance...Lift your game..

Reviews.Title: “wonderful new property - the place to be”
Reviews.Author: Sveenz
Reviews.Content: Brandnew hotel in a wonderful design, modern rooms and excellent location, spectacular views. The Front Office Department is already performing very well (despite the hotel just opened 30 days ago), always make you feel welcome with a friendly smile and in a professional manner anticipating needs. Food & Beverage still needs a lot of improvement. Staff is quite stressed and therefore not smiling. Breakfast quality is very good but variety could be better for 5 star hotel. Roof top terrace is the place to be with its spectacular views, but service needs a lot of training and improvement still; actually its a disaster but understandable for a new hotel, and the atmosphere makes up for it. This hotel is excellent in all aspects. I am sure that with some time and further training also the service in restaurants will be up to 5 stars standards. After completion of its sourroundings that are currently under construction, it will also be better accessible by any transportation. I would recommend this place to everybody looking for the distinctive experience and new standards. Its one of the most exciting hotels I have seen on this planet.

Reviews.Title: “A gem worthy of its stars”
Reviews.Author: t-puk
Reviews.Content: Finally, a new arrival in Singapore that will soon turn into the crown of Marina Bay. This is one place where you will miss for a long time. Most impressed with luggage handling. Was told room wasn't ready so we waited an hour, collected keys an hour later and was escorted up to the room, bags were already there properly arranged. All service calls and requests were handled promptly. Despite being fully booked, we never had to wait for anything. Check-in took awhile but front desk officer was most apologetic. From the scent that welcomes you (glamourous entrance through The Landing Point) to first point of contact with any staff member, the guest is made to feel unique and welcomed. Hardware is also top-notch in all aspects. Room amenities are well planned to make even the most fussy traveller smile. Bathroom stocked with huge bottles of Molton Brown toiletries, shower stall has power rainforest shower (extremely good water pressure, feels like tropical thunderstorm) with separate valves for the handset so no need to switch around! Rooftop pool and bar (aka The Lantern) is THE place to hangout. Superb views of Marina bay and vantage point for fireworks viewing, it was never too crowded even on a busy day. Pool and jacuzzi was warm - what a joy to soak in even on a sunny day. While the breakfast spread was not overwhelming, it was sufficient for a hearty meal. There were ready-made eggs benedict, but I'm sure the chef will glady whip up a fresh one upon request. Understated glamour with genuine service makes FBH a memorable shining gem. (Location can be abit of a hastle if you're walking, as one has to rely on the fullerton hotel - one fullerton underground link to get across to the MRT.)

Reviews.Title: “Stunning!”
Reviews.Author: mag_ty
Reviews.Content: I LOVE the Fullerton Bay Hotel. It's quaint & unique in its own small way. It's much smaller than its sister hotel, Fullerton Hotel (just opposite the end of the same street) which is also a sight to behold amongst all the modern buildings in the Central Business District. It has its own unique history in the past of being a working pier. Fullerton Bay gives a lux feel upon entry with its chandeliers & opulent looking cushions at the lobby. The Deluxe room (facing the Customs House) has a high ceiling that gives off a big room feel. The winners of the room are the TV screen that you can see from your tub in the bathroom & Nespresso coffee machine with complimentary coffee capsules. Free internet access comes with the package although it was highlighted at check-out that it's limited to 1 access at a time...this won't have mattered usually but I carried my iPad, notebook & iPhone that are logged on almost all the time - thankfully, the reception waived the charges for multiple access. I found the pillows too soft as my head sunk to the lowest point within minutes of rest. Up to the rooftop pool that has a rooftop bar area called Lantern. Next to the pool, it has 2 jacuzzis that overlook the Marina Bay skyline. There's a see-through glass wall on one side of the pool so you shouldn't mind being looked at in your bikinis. Service-wise at the pool - it's attentive but not excellent as I waited 1 hour for my order of 12 piece dim sum (costing me SGD$20 if I recall correctly) to arrive at the pool from the 1st level restaurant. The waiter kept checking & apologizing but it was still WAY TOO LONG for a snack to arrive - it was around 3p.m. & the pool was empty at that time. The pool side bar (Lantern) comes alive closer to evening & well into the night. Service-wise, it remains the same dismal standards as it took me around 20 mins to get the attention of a service staff to order my drinks & another 20 mins to pay for them. This time however, the place was quite full at 11p.m. as the scenery makes it a place to be seen in. Service during breakfast (Clifford) is excellent. The servers were attentive & prompt although their Fullerton Bay Egg Benedict could have been better as one came with a broken yolk. Request for change from coffee to tea was complied with without a whimper. Will definitely stay here again if I have the chance.

HotelInfo.Name: The Fullerton Bay Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 80 Collyer Quay, Singapore 049326, Singapore
